commit_message:
Run Octavia configuration on the overcloud

Fully configuring Octavia requires resources such as the load balancer
management network and amphora image to be created in the overcloud
during deployment. This is handled through some ansible driven through a
mistral workflow. This patch enables configuring and triggering this
workflow from heat.

Co-Authored-By: Brent Eagles <beagles@redhat.com>
Depends-on: If07ded033be9f44b7c7a7e09214032fa89a02e77

Change-Id: I2d10dbd33b3a0ed0463096849d01aa2c1b9f293e

subject: Guard against post-as-copy flattening large objects
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-18 17:55:19.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_service.py', 'tests/unit/test_swiftclient.py', 'tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'swiftclient/client.py', 'swiftclient/service.py'], 'message': 'Guard against post-as-copy flattening large objects

Previously, if a user POSTed to a large object and the cluster had
POST-as-COPY enabled, the entire contents of the large object would be
copied, rather than having the manifest copied in place. This had
several negative effects; such a POST:

 * was slower than necessary;
 * left orphaned segments, doubling storage utilization; and
 * would fail with Entity Too Large errors if the complete object was
   larger than max_file_size.

Now, when POSTing to an object through the CLI or SwiftService API,
automatically include a ?multipart-manifest=get query parameter to
prevent this. This will only be included if the target cluster is
running swift 1.13.1 or later; earlier versions would not automatically
preserve X-Object-Manifest headers during POSTs.

Additionally, Connection API users may use the new query_string argument
to post_object to include an arbitrary query string, regardless of
cluster version.

Change-Id: I3158b608746ebd17f6f4181be51d024d0f7de90c
Related-Change: I1073af9fee6e34ebdfad7b1a89aeb05e4523a151
Related-Bug: 1487791
'}]
commit_message:
Guard against post-as-copy flattening large objects

Previously, if a user POSTed to a large object and the cluster had
POST-as-COPY enabled, the entire contents of the large object would be
copied, rather than having the manifest copied in place. This had
several negative effects; such a POST:

 * was slower than necessary;
 * left orphaned segments, doubling storage utilization; and
 * would fail with Entity Too Large errors if the complete object was
   larger than max_file_size.

Now, when POSTing to an object through the CLI or SwiftService API,
automatically include a ?multipart-manifest=get query parameter to
prevent this. This will only be included if the target cluster is
running swift 1.13.1 or later; earlier versions would not automatically
preserve X-Object-Manifest headers during POSTs.

Additionally, Connection API users may use the new query_string argument
to post_object to include an arbitrary query string, regardless of
cluster version.

Change-Id: I3158b608746ebd17f6f4181be51d024d0f7de90c
Related-Change: I1073af9fee6e34ebdfad7b1a89aeb05e4523a151
Related-Bug: 1487791

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10267, 'name': 'venkata anil', 'email': 'anilvenkata@redhat.com', 'username': 'anil'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27686, 'name': 'yuhaijia', 'email': '505606823@qq.com', 'username': 'yuhaijia-1106'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-16 22:37:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': "l3_ha: only pass host into update_port when updating router port bindings

There is a race condition in update_routers_states that may result in
some fixed ips incorrectly deallocated from router ports. This may
happen if update_routers_states fetches ports' state before another
thread updates the list; then update_routers_states passes port payloads
with old fixed ips into update_port, which results in ip address
deallocation. Among other things, l3 agent will detect the change and
remove the affected subnet prefix from radvd configuration file, since
it doesn't configure extra_subnets for RA.

There is no need to pass full port payload into update_port just to set
host. This patch replaces the payload with a dict of one key - host.
This allows core plugin to handle just this host field change, leaving
existing allocations (and other port attributes) intact.

Change-Id: Ib2c661d6e2cb8e34676fd83e19b6cf65c232545d
Closes-Bug: #1743658
"}]
commit_message:
l3_ha: only pass host into update_port when updating router port bindings

There is a race condition in update_routers_states that may result in
some fixed ips incorrectly deallocated from router ports. This may
happen if update_routers_states fetches ports' state before another
thread updates the list; then update_routers_states passes port payloads
with old fixed ips into update_port, which results in ip address
deallocation. Among other things, l3 agent will detect the change and
remove the affected subnet prefix from radvd configuration file, since
it doesn't configure extra_subnets for RA.

There is no need to pass full port payload into update_port just to set
host. This patch replaces the payload with a dict of one key - host.
This allows core plugin to handle just this host field change, leaving
existing allocations (and other port attributes) intact.

Change-Id: Ib2c661d6e2cb8e34676fd83e19b6cf65c232545d
Closes-Bug: #1743658

subject: HostSpecific Over-rides: Add Ceph OSD to host targetable config
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-01-22 14:28:18.000000000', 'files': ['ceph/templates/configmap-etc.yaml', 'nova/templates/daemonset-compute.yaml', 'ceph/templates/daemonset-osd.yaml', 'helm-toolkit/templates/utils/_daemonset_overrides.tpl'], 'message': "HostSpecific Over-rides: Add Ceph OSD to host targetable config

This PS adds Ceph OSD's to the host specific over-rides, it also
simplifies the host-specific daemonset logic.

commit_message:
HostSpecific Over-rides: Add Ceph OSD to host targetable config

This PS adds Ceph OSD's to the host specific over-rides, it also
simplifies the host-specific daemonset logic.

commit_message:
Handle a resource delete race condition

When a resource is deleted from it's detail page, it returns to it's
parent page and also returns the action result. The detail page action
handler should ignore the delete event and thus not trying to load the
already deleted resource.

Change-Id: I5b4b33b5ea5716e5f005d388d68c9ecbcf09e2f9

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

This change also breaks the inheritance between
HorizonHAProxyContext and HAProxyContext (as this was
not needed) and aligns the code in HorizonHAProxyContext
to the behaviour in HAProxyContext of using get_relation_ip
instead of unit_get.

Change-Id: I72600b01744a07e140a29255efc2823ea39ce730
"}]
commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

This change also breaks the inheritance between
HorizonHAProxyContext and HAProxyContext (as this was
not needed) and aligns the code in HorizonHAProxyContext
to the behaviour in HAProxyContext of using get_relation_ip
instead of unit_get.

Change-Id: I72600b01744a07e140a29255efc2823ea39ce730

subject: Check that Glance returns image data before processing it
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 9303, 'name': 'Abhishek Kekane', 'email': 'akekane@redhat.com', 'username': 'abhishekkekane'}, {'_account_id': 11391, 'name': 'Mikhail Fedosin', 'email': 'mfedosin@redhat.com', 'username': 'fedosinme'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-05 18:43:53.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/unit/image/v2/test_image.py', 'openstackclient/image/v2/image.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1741223-7a5c5b6e7f232628.yaml'], 'message': 'Check that Glance returns image data before processing it

Now if Glance v2 cannot find image data it returns an empty
response with 204 status code, instead of raising an error.

Glance client handles this situation and wraps the response
with a RequestIdProxy object, whose 'wrapped' attribute is
None.

But when openstack client tries to parse this object using
glanceclient's save_image util function, it fails with
"NoneType object is not iterable" message, for the
object doesn't contain any data.

This patch adds additional check to prevent such behaviour
and raises SystemExit exception if no data was returned from
the server.

Glance v1 is not affected, because it raises an error if can't
find an image data.

Change-Id: I016a60462ba586f9fa7585c2cfafffd7be38de7b
Closes-Bug: #1741223
'}]
commit_message:
Check that Glance returns image data before processing it

Now if Glance v2 cannot find image data it returns an empty
response with 204 status code, instead of raising an error.

Glance client handles this situation and wraps the response
with a RequestIdProxy object, whose 'wrapped' attribute is
None.

But when openstack client tries to parse this object using
glanceclient's save_image util function, it fails with
"NoneType object is not iterable" message, for the
object doesn't contain any data.

This patch adds additional check to prevent such behaviour
and raises SystemExit exception if no data was returned from
the server.

Glance v1 is not affected, because it raises an error if can't
find an image data.

Change-Id: I016a60462ba586f9fa7585c2cfafffd7be38de7b
Closes-Bug: #1741223

commit_message:
Adopted to new oslo.context code to remove deprecation warnings

The following deprecation warnings are gone with the patch:

Using the 'user' argument is deprecated in version '2.18' and will be
removed in version '3.0', please use the 'user_id' argument instead

Using the 'tenant' argument is deprecated in version '2.18' and will be
removed in version '3.0', please use the 'project_id' argument instead

Property 'tenant' has moved to 'project_id' in version '2.6' and will be
removed in version '3.0'

Property 'user' has moved to 'user_id' in version '2.6' and will be
removed in version '3.0'

Property 'tenant' has moved to 'project_id' in version '2.6' and will be
removed in version '3.0'

Property 'domain' has moved to 'domain_id' in version '2.6' and will be
removed in version '3.0'

Property 'user_domain' has moved to 'user_domain_id' in version '2.6'
and will be removed in version '3.0'

Property 'project_domain' has moved to 'project_domain_id' in version
'2.6' and will be removed in version '3.0'

Change-Id: I0acda6e319c261c31ec553169ac099cd2ab28743
Partial-Bug: #1744363

commit_message:
Implement IPv6 support for Manila Dell EMC Unity driver

Major changes:
  * Support to create/delete/extend/access NFS and CIFS share/snapshot
    in the IPv6 network which created by Neutron
  * Support to connect Unity management interface using IPv6 address

Change-Id: I590d569c6fe1a0f8b146bec9c74513269b8358f4
Implements: blueprint unity-manila-ipv6-support

commit_message:
Refactored cinder tempest tests to cinder_tempest_plugin

* As per the current codebase of cinder tempest plugin, it is getting
  dumped in the cinder/tests and the package name is setup.cfg is
  cinder_tempest_plugin which does not exists. So i refactored to
  give a proper tempest plugin shape.

Change-Id: Ia78ea53a99923844f40fb4e9fe22ec0da4b0c335

commit_message:
log: augment json records

The ContextFormatter gathers more information about the request than
the JSONFormatter, which is rather opposite to what one might expect.
This patch pulls that logic out into a separate method allowing it to
be reused.

Change-Id: I27d9001150ec563fc7972a5b9ea6b55270ab652f
Closes-Bug: #1564931

subject: Fixed _log_console_output call on failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-18 21:33:31.000000000', 'files': ['barbican_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': "Fixed _log_console_output call on failure

_log_console_output is defined in tempest.scenario.manager.Manager but
the test class inherited from BaseTestCase that doesn't have it. So
whenever a test failure occurs, we don't log console output, which may
be handy when debugging gate issues.

Change-Id: I48701da8714c9e483401fd1ba987e4f2bef5bd23
Related-Bug: #1742936
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed _log_console_output call on failure

_log_console_output is defined in tempest.scenario.manager.Manager but
the test class inherited from BaseTestCase that doesn't have it. So
whenever a test failure occurs, we don't log console output, which may
be handy when debugging gate issues.

Change-Id: I48701da8714c9e483401fd1ba987e4f2bef5bd23

during calls.

oslotest.mock_fixture contains 2 components, one of them adds the autospec

autospec behaviour for mock.patch functions, and sets autospec to True by

commit_message:
tests: Use mock autospec in unit tests

Autospecing will ensure that the method signatures are respected
during calls.

oslotest.mock_fixture contains 2 components, one of them adds the autospec
argument to mock.Mock and mock.MagicMock, while the other one fixes the
autospec behaviour for mock.patch functions, and sets autospec to True by
default, unless otherwise specified.

Closes-Bug: #1735588

Change-Id: I5a1dd8571988859b4a14a505fd5e016079582363

commit_message:
Add --wsrep-new-cluster option back in the bootstrap_db function

Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5 removed the
"--wsrep-new-cluster" option and left "--wsrep-on=OFF".
But it seems "--wsrep-on=OFF" won't work with mariadb 10.0. and In
Ubuntu, we are still using mariadb 10.0.

Try to add --wsrep-new-cluster back

Change-Id: I4d382d1b9c83def62dc85a773580c8c6b2500f68

subject: [Trivial] Allow flushing named pipe log handles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-05 16:33:58.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/unit/utils/io/test_namedpipe.py', 'os_win/utils/io/namedpipe.py'], 'message': '[Trivial] Allow flushing named pipe log handles

The named pipe handler provided by os-win is used by Nova when
consuming instance serial ports. For convenience, it allows logging
the named pipe output to a file (useful for storing the serial
console output).

The issue is that the log file never gets flushed, thus Nova returns
incomplete results. This change adds a method that may be used for
flushing the log file.

Change-Id: I4b5eb7579ac0c92e9c3630539b0c4d76f5b98c6d
Closes-Bug: #1741494
'}]
commit_message:
[Trivial] Allow flushing named pipe log handles

The named pipe handler provided by os-win is used by Nova when
consuming instance serial ports. For convenience, it allows logging
the named pipe output to a file (useful for storing the serial
console output).

The issue is that the log file never gets flushed, thus Nova returns
incomplete results. This change adds a method that may be used for
flushing the log file.

Change-Id: I4b5eb7579ac0c92e9c3630539b0c4d76f5b98c6d
Closes-Bug: #1741494

subject: Add support for CephFS Native Manila backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-17 17:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/reference/manila-guide.rst', 'ansible/roles/manila/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/manila/tasks/external_ceph.yml', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible/roles/manila/templates/manila-share.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/manila/templates/manila.conf.j2', 'doc/source/reference/external-ceph-guide.rst', 'ansible/roles/manila/tasks/upgrade.yml', 'ansible/roles/manila/templates/manila-share.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/manila/tasks/deploy.yml'], 'message': 'Add support for CephFS Native Manila backend

One change that affects all manila backends is the configuration of the
enabled_share_protocols. This defaults to "NFS, CIFS", which I have
maintained for the existing backends. When it comes to the CephFS native
driver we need to add CEPHFS into the list.

Generally this has copied the pattern used in glance to support
connecting to an external ceph system, mixed with the existing way
manila backends are enabled.

Change-Id: If1c4307d47c3607a97c8b32d3f06fc64e80e94b4
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for CephFS Native Manila backend

One change that affects all manila backends is the configuration of the
enabled_share_protocols. This defaults to "NFS, CIFS", which I have
maintained for the existing backends. When it comes to the CephFS native
driver we need to add CEPHFS into the list.

Generally this has copied the pattern used in glance to support
connecting to an external ceph system, mixed with the existing way
manila backends are enabled.

Change-Id: If1c4307d47c3607a97c8b32d3f06fc64e80e94b4

Microversion 2.58 - Instance actions list pagination

os-instance-actions endpoints for pagination.

  bindings.
* Deprecate injected_files, injected_file_content_bytes, and
  injected_file_path_bytes from the nova quota-show,

commit_message:
Add support for the 2.57 microversion

With the 2.57 microversion, we:

* Deprecate the --file option from the nova boot and
  nova rebuild CLIs and API bindings.
* Add --user-data and --user-data-unset to the nova rebuild
  CLI and API bindings.
* Deprecate the maxPersonality and maxPersonalitySize fields
  from the nova limits and nova absolute-limits CLIs and API
  bindings.
* Deprecate injected_files, injected_file_content_bytes, and
  injected_file_path_bytes from the nova quota-show,
  nova quota-update, nova quota-defaults, nova quota-class-show,
  and nova quota-class-update CLIs and API bindings.

Part of blueprint deprecate-file-injection

Change-Id: Id13e3eac3ef87d429454042ac7046e865774ff8e

commit_message:
Create nl04.o.o configuration

Move our OVH provider to nl04.o.o (from nl02). This will allow us to
reduce the CPU usage on nl02.o.o.

Change-Id: I2d52e7d7c05a49b01b5538bf60630003b6aabad6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-19 11:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['test-log-collect.sh', 'Vagrantfile'], 'message': "Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM

Depending on the VM distro the working directory can either be rsync'd
to the VM or mounted. When the directory is mounted, various artifacts
are left behind from the test execution which is not desired especially
when the directory is shared between multiple VMs for parallel testing.
As such, it's best to simply copy the directory to the VM using 'rsync'
so each VM can get its own copy. This also restores the missing new line
at the end of the test-log-collect.sh script which got removed in
I4475e4dfe13acb4c88444f1f7aa88272bf87f6ee in order to make the linters
happy.

Change-Id: I1aab7d3f0d26f35dea84ae088fe78cfd2de79366
"}]
commit_message:
Vagrantfile: Use rsync to copy working directory to VM

Depending on the VM distro the working directory can either be rsync'd
to the VM or mounted. When the directory is mounted, various artifacts
are left behind from the test execution which is not desired especially
when the directory is shared between multiple VMs for parallel testing.
As such, it's best to simply copy the directory to the VM using 'rsync'
so each VM can get its own copy. This also restores the missing new line
at the end of the test-log-collect.sh script which got removed in
I4475e4dfe13acb4c88444f1f7aa88272bf87f6ee in order to make the linters
happy.

Change-Id: I1aab7d3f0d26f35dea84ae088fe78cfd2de79366

subject: Adds NIC hardware offload support
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2018-01-22 15:41:56.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/unit/utils/network/test_networkutils.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/test_hostutils.py', 'os_win/utils/network/networkutils.py', 'os_win/utils/hostutils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/nic-hardware-offload-support-5912c91b2da93044.yaml'], 'message': 'Adds NIC hardware offload support

Adds get_nic_hardware_offload_info method in hostutils, which
will return a list of dictionaries containing details regarding
different NIC hardware offload capacities for SR-IOV, IOV queue
pairs, VMQs, IPsec SAs.

Adds set_vswitch_port_offload method in networkutils, which will
set the given hardware offload options into the given switch port
(enable / disable SR-IOV or VMQ, set IOV queues, set offloaded IPsec

Implements: blueprint nic-hardware-offload

Change-Id: Ib2915bd4fe050b97597799f359b310eef7457c58
'}]
commit_message:
Adds NIC hardware offload support

Adds get_nic_hardware_offload_info method in hostutils, which
will return a list of dictionaries containing details regarding
different NIC hardware offload capacities for SR-IOV, IOV queue
pairs, VMQs, IPsec SAs.

Adds set_vswitch_port_offload method in networkutils, which will
set the given hardware offload options into the given switch port
(enable / disable SR-IOV or VMQ, set IOV queues, set offloaded IPsec
SAs).

Implements: blueprint nic-hardware-offload

Change-Id: Ib2915bd4fe050b97597799f359b310eef7457c58

commit_message:
Disable Active Port Detection when using ZMQ

Currently Active Port Detection and ZMQ have port collision.
This patch disables Active Port Detection when using ZMQ
in our suggested local.conf

Change-Id: I08fafee1e2f7ea31f89ca98904ee786e3b2b0747
Related-Bug: #1716933

subject: Guest agent won't start on Xenial Percona 5.7
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-18 16:01:46.000000000', 'files': ['integration/scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-xenial-percona/post-install.d/10-fix-mycnf'], 'message': 'Guest agent won't start on Xenial Percona 5.7

Trove guest agent on Ubuntu Xenial Percona 5.7 image won't start
because of a missing header/section in "/etc/mysql/my.cnf" file.

To fix that, we only have to check if a section exists, if not
a [mysql] section is automatically created.

Change-Id: If3b1166fc04985763ae522f5eac022d53f2a366f
Closes-Bug: #1744107
'}]
commit_message:
Guest agent won't start on Xenial Percona 5.7

Trove guest agent on Ubuntu Xenial Percona 5.7 image won't start
because of a missing header/section in "/etc/mysql/my.cnf" file.

To fix that, we only have to check if a section exists, if not
a [mysql] section is automatically created.

Change-Id: If3b1166fc04985763ae522f5eac022d53f2a366f
Closes-Bug: #1744107

commit_message:
Conductor: ensure build cleanup works with cells

Make use of the cell mapping for the instance build cleanup. This
was not dealt with correctly in the event that libvirt failed to
deploy an instance, for example with invalid vnic type passed by
Neutron.

Change-Id: Ie8145d9c659d1918fd7910a10aa32a605d892943
Closes-Bug: #1736946

commit_message:
Add get_traits() method to ComputeDriver

The get_traits() virt driver method can be used by virt driver
implementations to advertise the traits that are associated with the
resource provider representing a given compute node. If implemented, the
method should return an iterable of traits.

blueprint ironic-driver-traits

Change-Id: If395389af8aacb4dd9666e7af234891de1a7f1af

Usually, the concurrency is set to number of cpus / 2, however we are

commit_message:
Reducing tempest_workers to 1 for fs016

Usually, the concurrency is set to number of cpus / 2, however we are
seeing parallelism issues with this particular featureset when run tests
in parallel. So, let's test running the jobs without parallelism for
now.

Change-Id: Ieedde8797e8c9312e073366e0fabe31ca7482775
Related-To: #1742936

commit_message:
Implements AIDE Intrusion Detection System

Introduces a service to configure AIDE Intrusion Detection.

This service init's the database and copies the new database
to the active naming. It also sets a cron job, using email if
`AideEmail` is populated, otherwise the reports are sent to
`/var/log/aide/`.

AIDE rules can be supplied as a hash, and should the rules ever
be changed, the service will populate the new rules and re-init
a fresh integrity database.

Related-Blueprint: tripleo-aide-database
Depends-On: Iac2ceb7fc6b610f8920ae6f75faa2885f3edf6eb
Change-Id: I23d8ba2c43e907372fe079026df1fca5fa1c9881

subject: Introduce Filepath Opt
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-11 21:06:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/opts.rst', 'oslo_config/sphinxext.py', 'oslo_config/tests/test_types.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py', 'oslo_config/generator.py', 'oslo_config/types.py', 'releasenotes/notes/filepath-opt-8c2ccae98e4af011.yaml'], 'message': 'Introduce Filepath Opt

Currently there is no dedicated config opt type for config options
that take file paths or directory paths as values. Hence, many
projects are forced to use "StrOpt" and perform validation for the
file/directory path in the project.

This patch adds a new opt type "FilepathOpt" that takes either a
valid file path or directory path, thereby taking load of validation
off the depending projects.

Closes-Bug: #1677422

Change-Id: If67eb72c0055e3d6533d17943c76ed89982ad26d
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce Filepath Opt

Currently there is no dedicated config opt type for config options
that take file paths or directory paths as values. Hence, many
projects are forced to use "StrOpt" and perform validation for the
file/directory path in the project.

This patch adds a new opt type "FilepathOpt" that takes either a
valid file path or directory path, thereby taking load of validation
off the depending projects.

Closes-Bug: #1677422

Change-Id: If67eb72c0055e3d6533d17943c76ed89982ad26d

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-01-11 02:46:55.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/service.py', 'trove/templates/postgresql/config.template', 'integration/scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-postgresql/install.d/30-postgresql', 'integration/scripts/trovestack', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/replication/experimental/postgresql_impl.py', 'releasenotes/notes/pgsql-9.6-support-e4f2a210ac495161.yaml', 'trove/templates/postgresql/9.4/config.template'], 'message': 'Upgrade Postgresql support to v9.6

Modified existing Postgresql elements to support v9.6. Support
was retained for v9.4. To do this, some refactoring of trovestack
was undertaken; specifically, the VERSION and PACKAGE variable
determination was moved from cmd_set_datastore to a new function,
set_datastore_version_info(). This allows for the VERSION variable
to be used in the elements as well as at datastore add time.
The default for Postgresql will now be v9.6. v9.4 can be built like
this:
VERSION=9.4 ./trovestack kick-start postgresql

The config.template needed to be changed because the parameter
"checkpoint_segments" is no longer supported. The v9.4 version
of the file was retained and moved to a "9.4" directory which
will be detected during instance launch resulting in the correct
version of the file being sent to the instance.

Closes-bug: 1649084
Change-Id: Ia1c71d55cc25f544436e725869bac839d95e988e
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade Postgresql support to v9.6

Modified existing Postgresql elements to support v9.6. Support
was retained for v9.4. To do this, some refactoring of trovestack
was undertaken; specifically, the VERSION and PACKAGE variable
determination was moved from cmd_set_datastore to a new function,
set_datastore_version_info(). This allows for the VERSION variable
to be used in the elements as well as at datastore add time.
The default for Postgresql will now be v9.6. v9.4 can be built like
this:
VERSION=9.4 ./trovestack kick-start postgresql

The config.template needed to be changed because the parameter
"checkpoint_segments" is no longer supported. The v9.4 version
of the file was retained and moved to a "9.4" directory which
will be detected during instance launch resulting in the correct
version of the file being sent to the instance.

Closes-bug: 1649084
Change-Id: Ia1c71d55cc25f544436e725869bac839d95e988e

commit_message:
rehome shared constant

The SHARED constant is used in a number of projects [1]. This patch
rehomes the constant to neutron-lib for consumption and switches all
neutron-lib static uses of 'shared' to use the new constant.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=att.*%5C.SHARED

Change-Id: If123044496b54a8bfc115ab41b8506ec5d7ba5a3

subject: Replace assertFalse/assertTrue(a in b)
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8932, 'name': 'Telles Mota Vidal N√≥brega', 'email': 'tellesnobrega@gmail.com', 'username': 'tellesnobrega'}, {'_account_id': 10459, 'name': 'Luigi Toscano', 'email': 'ltoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltoscano'}, {'_account_id': 21690, 'name': 'chenpengzi', 'email': '1523688226@qq.com', 'username': 'chenpengzi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23078, 'name': 'Jeremy Freudberg', 'email': 'jeremyfreudberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'jeremyfreudberg'}, {'_account_id': 27361, 'name': 'Yandy Sun', 'email': 'sunyd@inspur.com', 'username': 'sunyandi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-01-22 09:21:12.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/tests/unit/plugins/storm/test_config_helper.py'], 'message': "Replace assertFalse/assertTrue(a in b)

Replace 'assertFalse(a in b)' with 'assertNotIn(a, b)'

Replace 'assertTrue(a in b)' with 'assertIn(a, b)'

[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality. Unit test assertions
tend to give better messages for more specific assertions. As a result,
assertEqual(...) is preferred over assertTrue(... == ...), and
assertNotEqual(...) is preferred over assertFalse(... == ...).
Off by default.

see more https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/latest/user/hacking.html

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: Ic21fa755faf218bc1c27dc9c839cf6f99f67d287
"}]
commit_message:
Replace assertFalse/assertTrue(a in b)

Replace 'assertFalse(a in b)' with 'assertNotIn(a, b)'

Replace 'assertTrue(a in b)' with 'assertIn(a, b)'

[H204] Use assert(Not)Equal to check for equality. Unit test assertions
tend to give better messages for more specific assertions. As a result,
assertEqual(...) is preferred over assertTrue(... == ...), and
assertNotEqual(...) is preferred over assertFalse(... == ...).
Off by default.

see more https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/latest/user/hacking.html

Trivial fix.

Change-Id: Ic21fa755faf218bc1c27dc9c839cf6f99f67d287

subject: Update zuul.yaml
revisions:

Rename tempest job to follow our naming for in-tree jobs since
we have a global shared namespace.

Rename ansible jobs for naming conventions, it needs to start with
dragonflow.

Remove legacy job here, it's in project-config and non-converted legacy
jobs should not be in the repo, it needs to be properly imported first.

Naming conventions reference:
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#naming-with-zuul-v3

Remove name from project stanza, it's not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I1f5f54ce3e70307541c78ba86f16086d38e877e8
"}]
commit_message:
Update zuul.yaml

Rename tempest job to follow our naming for in-tree jobs since
we have a global shared namespace.

Rename ansible jobs for naming conventions, it needs to start with
dragonflow.

Remove legacy job here, it's in project-config and non-converted legacy
jobs should not be in the repo, it needs to be properly imported first.

Naming conventions reference:
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#naming-with-zuul-v3

Remove name from project stanza, it's not needed anymore.

Change-Id: I1f5f54ce3e70307541c78ba86f16086d38e877e8

commit_message:
Rename jobs for zuul v3

Follow naming conventions from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3
to have jobs start with project-name since we share a global namespace.

Also, remove name from project stanza, it's not needed anymore.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-19 04:12:20.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/upgrade/upgrade.sh', 'zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': 'Always attempt to restart n-cpu/n-cond

During the upgrade sequence, as other services are
down or unavailable while processes are upgrading,
a number of errors are generated in the nova-compute
logging. This appears to possibly be a result of the
nova-conductor process failing and entering a loop
where it is continiously trying to restart.

As such, we need to always attempt to restart the
nova-compute and conductor services on the primary
node.

Closes-Bug: #1744139
Change-Id: I14cd8bfd20bd66efdad77e658a72bf5471a0f3d4
'}]
commit_message:
Always attempt to restart n-cpu/n-cond

During the upgrade sequence, as other services are
down or unavailable while processes are upgrading,
a number of errors are generated in the nova-compute
logging. This appears to possibly be a result of the
nova-conductor process failing and entering a loop
where it is continiously trying to restart.

As such, we need to always attempt to restart the
nova-compute and conductor services on the primary
node.

Closes-Bug: #1744139
Change-Id: I14cd8bfd20bd66efdad77e658a72bf5471a0f3d4

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-01-19 14:46:20.000000000', 'files': ['roles/modify-image/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/modify-image/tasks/libguestfs.yml'], 'message': "Set SUPERMIN_* variables to working kernel

virt-customize(libguestfs) is not working with current
kernel 3.10.0-693.11.6.el7 in centos.
So until it's fixed in libguestfs or kernel, let's
use working kernel 3.10.0-693.el7.x86_64.
The kernel version is managed using following variable
which can be overridden when required.
Libguesfs requires following environment variables
to use the overridden kernel.

- SUPERMIN_KERNEL_VERSION: {{ libguestfs_kernel_override }}
- SUPERMIN_KERNEL: /boot/vmlinuz-{{ libguestfs_kernel_override }}
- SUPERMIN_MODULES: /lib/modules/{{ libguestfs_kernel_override }}

Change-Id: I129ec6c48d801cd605c4befda5ee00a025480413
Partial-Bug: #1743749
"}]
commit_message:
Set SUPERMIN_* variables to working kernel

virt-customize(libguestfs) is not working with current
kernel 3.10.0-693.11.6.el7 in centos.
So until it's fixed in libguestfs or kernel, let's
use working kernel 3.10.0-693.el7.x86_64.
The kernel version is managed using following variable
which can be overridden when required.
Libguesfs requires following environment variables
to use the overridden kernel.

- SUPERMIN_KERNEL_VERSION: {{ libguestfs_kernel_override }}
- SUPERMIN_KERNEL: /boot/vmlinuz-{{ libguestfs_kernel_override }}
- SUPERMIN_MODULES: /lib/modules/{{ libguestfs_kernel_override }}

Change-Id: I129ec6c48d801cd605c4befda5ee00a025480413
Partial-Bug: #1743749

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-22 09:18:37.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/local.conf.example', 'tacker/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/HEAD', 'tacker/extensions/nfvo_plugins/vnfcluster.py', 'tacker/vnfm/policy_actions/recovery/recovery.py', 'releasenotes/source/locale/en_GB/LC_MESSAGES/releasenotes.po', 'samples/tosca-templates/vnfd/tosca-vnfd-cluster.yaml', 'tacker/tests/functional/nfvo/test_cluster.py', 'samples/cluster/cluster_policy_sample.yaml', 'tacker/db/nfvo/vnfcluster_db.py', 'tacker/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/9935da7e3bf9_adding_vnfcluster.py', 'tacker/extensions/nfvo.py', 'tacker/vnfm/policy_actions/recovery/__init__.py', 'tacker/vnfm/plugin.py', 'tacker/nfvo/drivers/vim/openstack_driver.py', 'tacker/nfvo/nfvo_plugin.py', 'tacker/db/nfvo/nfvo_db_plugin.py', 'tacker/tests/etc/samples/sample-cluster-policy.yaml', 'releasenotes/source/locale/fr/LC_MESSAGES/releasenotes.po', 'tacker/locale/es/LC_MESSAGES/tacker.po', 'setup.cfg', 'tacker/plugins/common/constants.py'], 'message': 'Implement Tacker Server to support VNF cluster features

Adding new features to support VNF deployment in form of ACTIVE members
and STANDBY members in cluster that guarantee High Availability to required
VNF in Tacker env.
This implementation enable some cluster-related operation such as: VNF
cluster and VNF cluster-member CRUD operations.
On the other hand, this implementation also introduce a new "respawn"
action in policy action whose name "recovery". "Recovery" action will
be triggered in the event of receiving event from monitoring drivers. The
recovery scenarios is depend on asssigned role of the failed cluster-member
in the system.
- In the case of failed cluster-member has ACTIVE role-> bring existing
STANDBY member up to ACTIVE member -> deploy a new STANDBY member -> delete
the failed member
- In the case of failed cluster-member has STANDBY role -> deploy a new
STANDBY member -> delete a failed member.

Change-Id: I5b1c44a073f30552c46962441189d724239315b1
blueprint: policy-based-vnf-cluster
Co-Authored-By: xuan0802 <thespring1989@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Implement Tacker Server to support VNF cluster features

Adding new features to support VNF deployment in form of ACTIVE members
and STANDBY members in cluster that guarantee High Availability to required
VNF in Tacker env.
This implementation enable some cluster-related operation such as: VNF
cluster and VNF cluster-member CRUD operations.
On the other hand, this implementation also introduce a new "respawn"
action in policy action whose name "recovery". "Recovery" action will
be triggered in the event of receiving event from monitoring drivers. The
recovery scenarios is depend on asssigned role of the failed cluster-member
in the system.
- In the case of failed cluster-member has ACTIVE role-> bring existing
STANDBY member up to ACTIVE member -> deploy a new STANDBY member -> delete
the failed member
- In the case of failed cluster-member has STANDBY role -> deploy a new
STANDBY member -> delete a failed member.

Change-Id: I5b1c44a073f30552c46962441189d724239315b1
blueprint: policy-based-vnf-cluster
Co-Authored-By: xuan0802 <thespring1989@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2018-01-19 13:17:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/user/manual-upgrade.rst', 'scripts/run-upgrade.sh', 'osa_toolkit/generate.py'], 'message': "Include P-Q changes into the upgrade script

We need to include changes in the upgrade script to handle
the changes done during the Queens timeframe:

- Inventory is fixed to prevent a stacktrace if a container
  default was moved from is_metal: False to is_metal: True,
  and now respects existing container properties.
- Ensuring previous inventory location isn't overriding the
  Queens inventory location in memory, by unsetting
  ANSIBLE_INVENTORY.
- Ensuring all containers are using the repo that was build
  during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I0fd3a8803bf345ccad07dc97968e104cd0a7bf70
Partial-Bug: #1741462
Closes-Bug: #1675810
"}]
commit_message:
Include P-Q changes into the upgrade script

We need to include changes in the upgrade script to handle
the changes done during the Queens timeframe:

- Inventory is fixed to prevent a stacktrace if a container
  default was moved from is_metal: False to is_metal: True,
  and now respects existing container properties.
- Ensuring previous inventory location isn't overriding the
  Queens inventory location in memory, by unsetting
  ANSIBLE_INVENTORY.
- Ensuring all containers are using the repo that was build
  during the upgrade.

Change-Id: I0fd3a8803bf345ccad07dc97968e104cd0a7bf70
Partial-Bug: #1741462
Closes-Bug: #1675810

commit_message:
Run docker-puppet.py in debug mode.

Allow running docker-puppet.py in
debug mode, depending on the value
of the ansible variable docker_puppet_debug.

This variable takes its value from DockerPuppetDebug,
which is set to true in the env file
environments/config-debug.yaml.

commit_message:
bgpvpn: agent extension, fix port association 'routes' update

This change fixes the code to handle port association updates:
if an update adds routes and removes routes, we were
only detaching removed routes.

Change-Id: Ib8c7d3162d5322702ad6a149f903b1c705daabd8
Closes-Bug: 1743574

commit_message:
Modify the mistake of lbaas api-ref

There is no definition for "status" and "status_description" params
in the pool.
The protocol_port of listener and the delay of healthmonitor is an
integer.
The patch modifies those mistakes.

Change-Id: I205d8abf38669eb5335574e1dc25d2e644a33faa

commit_message:
Collect /var/lib/tripleo-config dir

We're facing an issue in upgrade CI where paunch fails with "sequence
item 33: expected string, list found", it's hard to see what triggered
the issue, being able to look at the step config fed into paunch could
help.

This is how the dir looks on my current deployment:

[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# du -h /var/lib/tripleo-config/
176K    /var/lib/tripleo-config/

[root@overcloud-controller-2 ~]# ls -1 /var/lib/tripleo-config/
docker-container-startup-config-step_1.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_2.json
docker-container-startup-config-step_3.json

commit_message:
Add tempest-plugins to projects.txt

All these tempest-plugin repos now use the check-requirements template,
so add them to the list of projects so that they get updated together
with the projects they test.

Note this change also sorts projects.txt alphabetically again.

Change-Id: Ifc631b29cd4d782280b6d38afd90ca6979e424fc
Depends-On: Id616198554f6261f4a3557a7c2d97c24c5be0a58

Fixes 'Not enough available memory' log message

Fixes a bug in log output about where 'Not enough available
memory to schedule instance' printed full memory instead of
available memory

Closes-Bug: #1735321

commit_message:
routes-control: add 'local_pref' attribute to BGPVPN resource

This adds the 'local_pref' attribute to the BGPVPN resource,
in the DB model definition and migration script, and also
in the API dicts.

Change-Id: I8a4a2ffa0f9f1d8131d2ced735852ad2310642f3
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

subject: Remove obsolete tempest-lib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-20 17:31:59.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: I677d4a215000ae662bb981462c7f000653054d9b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

commit_message:
Fix the storage group missing for external ceph

Using external Ceph with Kolla means there is no storage node for
kolla, but cinder-volume must be run on nodes(it can be controller
nodes or compute nodes), and the external-ceph-guide miss storage node,
this patch to fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1740028
Change-Id: I6cfb86c5c0d7b30291bd9f263fb030e4703d9602

commit_message:
Deprecates old OpenContrail driver

The first OpenContrail Driver was not developed with production ready in mind,
it was more a proof of concept. We do not recommend to use it in production.
Instead a production ready driver is available in the OpenContrail
monolithic Neutron core plugin tree.
This patch deprecates the driver in the Queens release and we plan to
completly remove it in Rocky release.

Change-Id: I07a7e462e174207499f0641a15467a7122447b7e
Partial-Bug: #1743820

commit_message:
bugs-fixed-since: add argument to list StoryBoard entries

If enabled, this includes StoryBoard stories in the output, with a
"storyboard:" prefix.

Example output:
$ ./bugs-fixed-since.py -sb -r ../octavia --start=1.0.0
storyboard:2001193
storyboard:2001424
1713873
storyboard:2001401
[...]

This is disabled for compatibility with other tools parsing
bugs-fixed-since output

Change-Id: Iddde675254a8622d498cab581d522bffdd7fbaae

commit_message:
db: refresh port association db object after route update

When routes are removed or added to a port association
DB, we need to refresh our DB object or else the dict
produced will be generated from the non-updated set of
routes.

Change-Id: Ib77813247058a4dafed5c36b3dc46717282f200a
Related-Bug: 1743574

commit_message:
helm-toolkit prometheus service annotation clean up

This adds checks for the fields in the service annotations for
prometheus, similar to the pod annotations. It changes the
setting of annotations by ingesting a prometheus: key under a
top-level monitoring tree to allow for configuration of other
monitoring solutions aside from prometheus

Change-Id: Id05f235ae07407ea4dcd45bce3a26dd92293b116

subject: only make single request for container listings
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-01-19 11:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_container.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_base.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': 'only make single request for container listings

The proxy was making multiple backend requests for each
container object or shard range listing when handling a
sharded container listing, but only using one response.
Change that to use a single subrequest.

Also re-work _get_sharded in attempt to make flow easier
to follow and get better separation of the sharding state

Also add unit tests for sharded container listing handling
in proxy controller.

Change-Id: I1a99d606ef5c6e980879c116d4ad8d3da39fd247
'}]
commit_message:
only make single request for container listings

The proxy was making multiple backend requests for each
container object or shard range listing when handling a
sharded container listing, but only using one response.
Change that to use a single subrequest.

Also re-work _get_sharded in attempt to make flow easier
to follow and get better separation of the sharding state
special cases.

Also add unit tests for sharded container listing handling
in proxy controller.

Change-Id: I1a99d606ef5c6e980879c116d4ad8d3da39fd247

subject: Simplify proxy-server getting sharded listings
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-01-19 11:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/server.py', 'test/probe/test_sharder.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py'], 'message': 'Simplify proxy-server getting sharded listings

Ensure that the container-server GET response for shard ranges always
returns a list that covers the entire namespace. This allows
simplification of the proxy-server side GET code.

While in sharding state the container may not yet have an entire
namespace worth of shard ranges so when necessary a filler shard range
is added on the container-server side to cover any as yet uncleaved
namespace.

Drive-by fix for container listing limit param not being cast to int
before being used in calculations.

Adds new probe test specifically to test listings with params during
sharding.

Change-Id: Ib38d75e04008509f4934bddf885fe030e56dfad0
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify proxy-server getting sharded listings

Ensure that the container-server GET response for shard ranges always
returns a list that covers the entire namespace. This allows
simplification of the proxy-server side GET code.

While in sharding state the container may not yet have an entire
namespace worth of shard ranges so when necessary a filler shard range
is added on the container-server side to cover any as yet uncleaved
namespace.

Drive-by fix for container listing limit param not being cast to int
before being used in calculations.

Adds new probe test specifically to test listings with params during
sharding.

Change-Id: Ib38d75e04008509f4934bddf885fe030e56dfad0

commit_message:
[placement] Fix getting placement request ID

In response headers, there is no 'openstack-request-id' header.
So it is not necessary to check the 'openstack-request-id' header.

And 'x-openstack-request-id' is defined in oslo.middleware.
So use the constant value in oslo.middleware.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py

Change-Id: Id14fb86ea9786bb22eb6b206cb10f115f9b56ea2
(cherry-picked from commit 560ebe4a56fb45e222d6b008eaabf87b2ccd53e4)

The ``[scenario]/img_dir`` option was prematurely deprecated ahead of

upload[1], this has not been fully implemented and the option is still
required if the user wants to use anything but the default. This patch

commit_message:
Undeprecate [scenario]/img_dir

The ``[scenario]/img_dir`` option was prematurely deprecated ahead of
providing a replacement option. Even though the eventual intention is to
be able to remove it in favor of requiring a full path to the image to
upload[1], this has not been fully implemented and the option is still
required if the user wants to use anything but the default. This patch
undeprecates the option so that, while the other work is being
completed, the option can be used without creating a frustrating user
experience. When a replacement option is introduced, this option can be
deprecated again.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1393881
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/scenario/manager.py?h=17.2.0#n389

Change-Id: I320237b84b641749aa0db3967e957c9ae94e5ea2
Closes-bug: #1740258

commit_message:
Fix upgrade test

openstacksdk was updated to 0.10.0 which has a different
connection.Connection object, which doesn't take our auth_url.

We should respect the constraints, install the tooling in a venv,
and restrict to a known version of the sdk until more robust code
is written.

commit_message:
OVSBridge: add --strict to allow priority in delete_flows

n8g-sfc currently has its own variant of OVSBridge to allow the use
of priority in a delete_flows call

This change is meant to make this available outside n8g-sfc and
simplify n8g-sfc code.

This change adds a 'strict' boolean parameter to mod_flow and delete_flows
that results in ovs-ofctl to be run with --strict for del-flows and
mod-flows actions.  When strict is set, the use of priority is allowed
and hence not rejected anymore.

Note that for batched actions in a deffered bridge, we disallow mixing
calls with strict and without strict, which can't be translated in one CLI
call.

Needed-By: I3bf939590dd43bff685f133bff86eb7e9068de91
Change-Id: I289d546780f10dc1002ab6bc2e1b38c9ef2d728f
(cherry picked from commit 5981bf416d39f8ec15c937dabaf16d39a101d6ee)

commit_message:
Add zipl support for s390 architecture with SCSI boot

s390x architecture has zipl as a bootloader. It requires special
treatment in order to make the image bootable.
After mounting the image we install a SCSI-type bootmap on the
volume.

addressed conflict with 287784

Change-Id: I88fb1e4cb8abc28663798e5d22d3a9d209a0e05e
Signed-off-by: Holger Smolinski <smolinski@de.ibm.com>

subject: XenAPI: Support neutron configuration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 167, 'name': 'Christian Berendt', 'email': 'berendt@osism.tech', 'username': 'berendt'}, {'_account_id': 6735, 'name': 'Bob Ball', 'email': 'bob.ball@citrix.com', 'username': 'bob-ball'}, {'_account_id': 7488, 'name': 'Jeffrey Zhang', 'email': 'zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com', 'username': 'Jeffrey4l'}, {'_account_id': 17920, 'name': 'Jianghua Wang', 'email': 'jianghua.wang@citrix.com', 'username': 'wjhfresh'}, {'_account_id': 19316, 'name': 'Eduardo Gonzalez', 'email': 'dabarren@gmail.com', 'username': 'egonzalez90'}, {'_account_id': 22165, 'name': 'caoyuan', 'email': 'cao.yingjunz@gmail.com', 'username': 'caoyuan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25638, 'name': 'Naichuan Sun', 'email': 'naichuan.sun@citrix.com', 'username': 'naichuans'}, {'_account_id': 27609, 'name': 'ZHICE WANG', 'email': 'wangzc@awcloud.com', 'username': 'wangzhice'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2018-01-19 11:00:03.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/neutron/templates/neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/neutron/handlers/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/templates/ml2_conf.ini.j2', 'ansible/roles/neutron/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/neutron/templates/ml2_conf_xenapi.ini.j2', 'ansible/roles/neutron/tasks/config.yml'], 'message': "XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses
the HIMN(Host Internal Management Network) to communicate with
dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi
  This new agent service will run in the compute hosts and controls
  the OVS running in XenServer dom0; the existing agent service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will run in the network hosts and controls
  the OVS running in network hosts.

* It retrieves XenAPI variables from the json file generated at XenAPI
  bootstrap.

* Basing on the XenAPI variables, it will customize relative ml2_conf.ini's
  configure options in a new template which will override the default options.
  e.g.
  * of_listen_address:
  XenAPI use the local himn interface's IP as of_listen_address, so
  that the ovs running dom0 can receive OpenFlow rules from the service
  of neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.
  * ovsdb_connection:
  XenAPI use XenServer dom0's HIMN IP as the OVS DB connection IP, so
  that neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi can connect to dom0's OVS DB.
  * host:
  Use the dom0's hostname.

* At the moment, l2_population doesn't for for XenAPI. So disable it.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin

* Neutron OVS agent configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: Iaee0a6c84069b3e6015b00de7aea880cdd33ab09
blueprint: xenserver-support
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Support neutron configuration

When using XenAPI as the compute virt driver, we need an OVS agent
to manage the OVS running in XenServer dom0. This OVS agent uses
the HIMN(Host Internal Management Network) to communicate with
dom0's OVS. This commit includes the following changes:

* Add a new ovs agent service - neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi
  This new agent service will run in the compute hosts and controls
  the OVS running in XenServer dom0; the existing agent service -
  neutron-openvswitch-agent will run in the network hosts and controls
  the OVS running in network hosts.

* It retrieves XenAPI variables from the json file generated at XenAPI
  bootstrap.

* Basing on the XenAPI variables, it will customize relative ml2_conf.ini's
  configure options in a new template which will override the default options.
  e.g.
  * of_listen_address:
  XenAPI use the local himn interface's IP as of_listen_address, so
  that the ovs running dom0 can receive OpenFlow rules from the service
  of neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi.
  * ovsdb_connection:
  XenAPI use XenServer dom0's HIMN IP as the OVS DB connection IP, so
  that neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi can connect to dom0's OVS DB.
  * host:
  Use the dom0's hostname.

* At the moment, l2_population doesn't for for XenAPI. So disable it.

References:

* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin

* Neutron OVS agent configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/configuration/openvswitch-agent.html

Change-Id: Iaee0a6c84069b3e6015b00de7aea880cdd33ab09
blueprint: xenserver-support

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2018-01-19 11:00:03.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/nova/tasks/bootstrap_xenapi.yml', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible/roles/nova/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': "XenAPI: Support compute node bootstrap

This is to add a bootstrap task for XenAPI to bootstrap the compute
node. One compute node is composed with a XenServer and a DomU VM
running on the XenServer. Before it's ready for deploying OpenStack
sevices on it, we need bootstrap it firstly. The package of
python-os-xenapi contains a tool and some utils which were developed
to finish all of the needed bootstrap tasks
e.g.:
1. configure himn(host internal management network)
2. configure ipatables to allow traffic
3. install xapi plugins to dom0
4. gather XenAPI facts and save them into a file
...

The task added in this commit is to invoke that tool so that the
bootstrap tasks can be completed automatically during kolla deployment.

Change-Id: I1500535a1c9a085bcbfec5db5fbddcf040e6892d
blueprint: xenserver-support
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Support compute node bootstrap

This is to add a bootstrap task for XenAPI to bootstrap the compute
node. One compute node is composed with a XenServer and a DomU VM
running on the XenServer. Before it's ready for deploying OpenStack
sevices on it, we need bootstrap it firstly. The package of
python-os-xenapi contains a tool and some utils which were developed
to finish all of the needed bootstrap tasks
e.g.:
1. configure himn(host internal management network)
2. configure ipatables to allow traffic
3. install xapi plugins to dom0
4. gather XenAPI facts and save them into a file
...

The task added in this commit is to invoke that tool so that the
bootstrap tasks can be completed automatically during kolla deployment.

Depends-On: Ie2d7d40f2755580aac4a10f3d302190a8bd4fe6f
Change-Id: I1500535a1c9a085bcbfec5db5fbddcf040e6892d
blueprint: xenserver-support

commit_message:
Added the limit on selection of delayed calls

It would be good when you have many Mistral-Engine instances.
It distributes selection of delayed calls between all of them.
Also replaced the sleep function by the await function in the tests.

Change-Id: I4f0e0a79ff8169ee4e9b359015db22898f634614
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
Wait for volume creation

If users create a container with new cinder volumes and the volumes
are 'creating'. Zun should wait for the volume creation before
proceeding the container creation process.

Change-Id: I423a69a97271a2acdd73a85cccddb65b052d169e
Closes-Bug: #1740942

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for magnum

Provide support fot kolla dev mode in Magnum. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'magnum_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of Magnum project is cloned
and bindmounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: Id479bf4dc77ee4a2367c9c7d8f0f00de761b8c85

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2018-01-19 15:43:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py'], 'message': 'Track associated sharing RPs in report client

With this change, SchedulerReportClient keeps track of any sharing
providers associated by aggregate with the compute node RP in the same
way as traits and aggregates.  Specifically:

- We use ProviderTree methods to save the information for each provider.
- We refresh sharing RP information along with aggregate and trait
  information whenever we "ensure" a provider exists.

Note that we also retrieve and track the aggregates and traits
associated with each sharing provider.

The refreshing (including cache expiry) of sharing RPs is done in the
same method with that of aggregate and trait associations.  The theory
being that all of these associations should change out of band with
roughly the same frequency (i.e. very rarely).

Change-Id: I840ebc7940e65af30e66d902bf360668ccb5a30e
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
'}]
commit_message:
Track associated sharing RPs in report client

With this change, SchedulerReportClient keeps track of any sharing
providers associated by aggregate with the compute node RP in the same
way as traits and aggregates.  Specifically:

- We use ProviderTree methods to save the information for each provider.
- We refresh sharing RP information along with aggregate and trait
  information whenever we "ensure" a provider exists.

Note that we also retrieve and track the aggregates and traits
associated with each sharing provider.

The refreshing (including cache expiry) of sharing RPs is done in the
same method with that of aggregate and trait associations.  The theory
being that all of these associations should change out of band with
roughly the same frequency (i.e. very rarely).

Change-Id: I840ebc7940e65af30e66d902bf360668ccb5a30e
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

subject: Access Tempest config.CONF directly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-18 17:16:11.000000000', 'files': ['heat_tempest_plugin/config.py', 'heat_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_heat_api.py', 'heat_tempest_plugin/common/test.py', 'heat_tempest_plugin/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Access Tempest config.CONF directly

This ensures that all Tempest plugin configs are loaded. Accessing it
via heat_tempest_plugin.config.CONF assumed that something else was
loading the plugin configs before we tried to access it. This is
probably only the case when running Tempest itself, but we want to be
able to discover and run tests from the heat_integrationtests without
going through Tempest.

Change-Id: I5e9325766ce166e62c731330c462c030cb1e11fc
'}]
commit_message:
Access Tempest config.CONF directly

This ensures that all Tempest plugin configs are loaded. Accessing it
via heat_tempest_plugin.config.CONF assumed that something else was
loading the plugin configs before we tried to access it. This is
probably only the case when running Tempest itself, but we want to be
able to discover and run tests from the heat_integrationtests without
going through Tempest.

Change-Id: I5e9325766ce166e62c731330c462c030cb1e11fc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-19 22:40:41.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/base.py'], 'message': 'Handle missing flavor.id in server response

Change Ie2d57029ad01cbe9e2b015857d6b95f77a97be19 introduced checks
for a servers flavor ID. This data is no longer returned after
Nova API microversion 2.46, causing problems for any tests/clients
requesting a higher version number.

Since these tests are not concerned with validating flavors, just
check if it is returned in the base class and skip the check if
it is not available.

Change-Id: Id7760cdfb9874014e03c7d8ebe269a03562bde18
Closes-bug: #1744401
'}]
commit_message:
Handle missing flavor.id in server response

Change Ie2d57029ad01cbe9e2b015857d6b95f77a97be19 introduced checks
for a servers flavor ID. This data is no longer returned after
Nova API microversion 2.46, causing problems for any tests/clients
requesting a higher version number.

Since these tests are not concerned with validating flavors, just
check if it is returned in the base class and skip the check if
it is not available.

Change-Id: Id7760cdfb9874014e03c7d8ebe269a03562bde18
Closes-bug: #1744401

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-19 22:01:48.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/identity/admin/v2/test_tokens.py'], 'message': "Restrict test_list_endpoints_for_token to tempest

The test_list_endpoints_for_token test now checks for services in
service_available, however that may include services from plugins.
We don't have a strong contract on the meaning of service_available
so this is not correct as it will look in the catalog for things
that may not even be OpenStack services.

Fixing this by restricting by services in Tempest (including keystone).

Change-Id: I32f4f056ea49fe04bfc309abe2cc9b9234b92847
Closes-bug: #1743996
"}]
commit_message:
Restrict test_list_endpoints_for_token to tempest

The test_list_endpoints_for_token test now checks for services in
service_available, however that may include services from plugins.
We don't have a strong contract on the meaning of service_available
so this is not correct as it will look in the catalog for things
that may not even be OpenStack services.

Fixing this by restricting by services in Tempest (including keystone).

Change-Id: I32f4f056ea49fe04bfc309abe2cc9b9234b92847
Closes-bug: #1743996

Ceilometer in Ocata made several changes to
move away from  oslo config's global conf.
Instead ceilometer/service.py now creates a
oslo config object that gets passed to the
publisher.

To keep up with the changes had to make

3.) Added monasca_ceilometer_opts to
intialize all ConfigOpts. This will have
to be regiested in ceilometer/opts.py.
(will need a additional line in opts.py)

service_username, service_password and
service_auth_url since username, password
and auth_url were removed from
[service_credentials] section.
5.) Added api/health.py, service.py
and opts.py from ceilometer code base

monasca ceilometer options via
monasca_ceilometer_opts.py
6.) Added ostestr to test requirements
and updated tox.ini to run tests in
serial (to avoid problems with
singleton mapping classes, stepping
on each other test values  when
run in parallel)

List of Ceilometer changes to remove
global conf
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384834
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384624
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386025

This change also modifies test-requirements.txt
to bring this master branch up to the stable/pike
version of ceilometer, and python-monascaclient
up to 1.7.1 (pike).

Change-Id: Ieb7962a50fdb5d12ea6238c96ed116e8b2c83c48
"}]
commit_message:
Remove oslo config global conf dependency

Ceilometer in Ocata made several changes to
move away from  oslo config's global conf.
Instead ceilometer/service.py now creates a
oslo config object that gets passed to the
publisher.

To keep up with the changes had to make
the following changes in monasca-ceilometer
1.) Monasca Publisher now extends
ConfigPublisherBase, with conf as argument
2.) monasca_client now takes conf as an
argument during intialization.
3.) Added monasca_ceilometer_opts to
intialize all ConfigOpts. This will have
to be regiested in ceilometer/opts.py.
(will need a additional line in opts.py)
4.) Introduced three new properties
service_username, service_password and
service_auth_url since username, password
and auth_url were removed from
[service_credentials] section.
5.) Added api/health.py, service.py
and opts.py from ceilometer code base
which were modified to read
monasca ceilometer options via
monasca_ceilometer_opts.py
6.) Added ostestr to test requirements
and updated tox.ini to run tests in
serial (to avoid problems with
singleton mapping classes, stepping
on each other test values  when
run in parallel)

List of Ceilometer changes to remove
global conf
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384834
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384624
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386025

This change also modifies test-requirements.txt
to bring this master branch up to the stable/pike
version of ceilometer, and python-monascaclient
up to 1.7.1 (pike).

Change-Id: Ieb7962a50fdb5d12ea6238c96ed116e8b2c83c48

1. What is the problem?

A security group(sg) may map to several local sg in local neutron.
During the deletion of sg local neutron may recreate the sg if it
recieve a get-request of sg.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

The solution to resource deleting is covered in
specs/queens/resource deleting.rst

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: Ia537c8a32f527e64d733b2a0bd7c90b400cd747f
'}]
commit_message:
Security group deletion

1. What is the problem?

A security group(sg) may map to several local sg in local neutron.
During the deletion of sg local neutron may recreate the sg if it
recieve a get-request of sg.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

The solution to resource deleting is covered in
specs/queens/resource deleting.rst

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: Ia537c8a32f527e64d733b2a0bd7c90b400cd747f

commit_message:
Add a active-standby mode memcached in haproxy

Memcached do not support cluster. Then make it work in active-standby
mode. This will be helpful to implement high available when using memcached
as tooz backend.

subject: Document RBAC Policy allowed values
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-06 20:10:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/openstack/neutron/test_neutron_rbac_policy.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/neutron/rbac_policy.py'], 'message': 'Document RBAC Policy allowed values

For entirely spurious reasons, RBAC Policies were validated using a custom
validate() method that is invisible to the user instead of using
constraints to validate values in a way consistent with all other resource
types, and that would appear in the API documentation. This rectifies that
error and improves the documentation and error reporting.

Change-Id: I0cde2fe5dd5c57c6f5a367d0405bcffad01678fa
'}]
commit_message:
Document RBAC Policy allowed values

For entirely spurious reasons, RBAC Policies were validated using a custom
validate() method that is invisible to the user instead of using
constraints to validate values in a way consistent with all other resource
types, and that would appear in the API documentation. This rectifies that
error and improves the documentation and error reporting.

Change-Id: I0cde2fe5dd5c57c6f5a367d0405bcffad01678fa

commit_message:
ipv4 address for overcloud nodes in ssh.config.ansible

The ansible_fqdn variable appears to be getting
overwritten during fact gathering.  Create a unique
variable to define the default address for overcloud
nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1742528
Change-Id: I85a2e76c4582e3a95f407e2d1edbf6051bf3525b

commit_message:
Able to change admin state for all resources

Also make the workflow more independent and predictable. Previously it
is using the extensible workflow methods and does not make a copy of
a step for each workflow, which would mess up with each other.

Change-Id: I2e808282ed3c180105978f359fff7558d9e78ca7
Story: 1713844
Task: 5361

subject: Convert bashate-python36-fedora-26 to Zuul v3
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-21 21:07:15.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/legacy/bashate-python36-fedora-26/post.yaml', 'playbooks/legacy/bashate-python36-fedora-26/run.yaml', '.zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Convert bashate-python36-fedora-26 to Zuul v3

Convert the job to native Zuul v3. The repo does not use
upper-constraints, so there's no  need to use openstack/requirements.

Rename the job to follow our naming pattern for tox jobs.

Also, remove project name from stanza, it's not needed for in-tree
configuration anymore.

Change-Id: If79bc60b7e60d172c64dee1cd7900853aa7a1f37
"}]
commit_message:
Convert bashate-python36-fedora-26 to Zuul v3

Convert the job to native Zuul v3. The repo does not use
upper-constraints, so there's no  need to use openstack/requirements.

Rename the job to follow our naming pattern for tox jobs.

Also, remove project name from stanza, it's not needed for in-tree
configuration anymore.

Change-Id: If79bc60b7e60d172c64dee1cd7900853aa7a1f37

commit_message:
Fix senlin tempest plugin to work properly

* moved testfiles into tests subdirectory
* fix basepath for plugin
* fix entrypoint
* provide steps in README to install and use senlin-tempest-plugin
* add config option when creating clusters to test node naming
* removed test drivers
* fix various test cases
* Replace deprecated aliases 'os'/'os_adm' with 'os_primary'/'os_admin'

Change-Id: I7551783a4e9b2194559c3a400594227b2d9c26b9

subject: Fix the bug that could not create a profile with Chinese availability_zone
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-01-20 02:33:58.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/test_common_schema.py', 'senlin/common/schema.py'], 'message': 'Fix the bug that could not create a profile with Chinese availability_zone

There has an error message with " 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in
 position 0-1: ordinal not in range(128)" when I create a profile with
Chinese availability_zone.
Then I found the str(value) send an error if the value is u'\u53ef\u7528\u52ff\u5220'
in schema.py when validate the profile. I add a if to judge the value is
unicode or not.

Closes-Bug: #1739877
Change-Id: I2a6568729a6280cc29c8f58f67a290b289714aac
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the bug that could not create a profile with Chinese availability_zone

There has an error message with " 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in
 position 0-1: ordinal not in range(128)" when I create a profile with
Chinese availability_zone.
Then I found the str(value) send an error if the value is u'\u53ef\u7528\u52ff\u5220'
in schema.py when validate the profile. I add a if to judge the value is
unicode or not.

Closes-Bug: #1739877
Change-Id: I2a6568729a6280cc29c8f58f67a290b289714aac

The DocumentedRuleDefault class has advantages over the RuleDefault
class because it allows project developers the opportunity to
describe how policies map to actual APIs. This makes things a lot
easier for operators trying to understand policies for a given
project, and doesn't require them to dig in the code to figure out
what they protect.

Polices are also splitted into small files for easier maintainance.

This is part of an effort to move policy and documentation of policy
into code, treating it like configuration.

bp policy-and-docs-in-code

Change-Id: Ifcdbccae7350ec69ad7d92197b9bfca8aeb8352b

commit_message:
Use DocumentedRuleDefault instead of RuleDefault

The DocumentedRuleDefault class has advantages over the RuleDefault
class because it allows project developers the opportunity to
describe how policies map to actual APIs. This makes things a lot
easier for operators trying to understand policies for a given
project, and doesn't require them to dig in the code to figure out
what they protect.

Polices are also splitted into small files for easier maintainance.

This is part of an effort to move policy and documentation of policy
into code, treating it like configuration.

bp policy-and-docs-in-code

Co-Authored-By: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ifcdbccae7350ec69ad7d92197b9bfca8aeb8352b

commit_message:
Remove local subclass of Object and ObjectField

These two classes were temporary hacks due to bugs in upstream
oslo.versionedobjects. With current global requirements setting version
of oslo.versionedobjects to 1.28, this is no longer needed.

Change-Id: Icec8d9689cd5634c9f29bfdd8899126853cd6550

commit_message:
[Urgent] fix unit test errors

This patch fixes two unit test errors. One is "ipv6_address_mode not
found", the other is "has no attribute type_manager". The first error
is addressed by the previous patch[1] but cannot be merged due to the
second error, so this patch address these two errors at the same time.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532417/

subject: Rename zuul v3 job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-21 19:31:42.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': "Rename zuul v3 job

Rename job to follow naming conventions for a shared global namespace:
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3

Also, remove name from project stanza, it's not needed for in-tree zuul
files anymore.

Keep old name to allow renaming, a followup will remove it.

Needed-By: I2dd2075e41680d7b85d574575a19531599dabf5e
Change-Id: Id2aed659c1fcb7333b7efa4dc0a019d21bdcd51a
"}]
commit_message:
Rename zuul v3 job

Rename job to follow naming conventions for a shared global namespace:
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3

Also, remove name from project stanza, it's not needed for in-tree zuul
files anymore.

Keep old name to allow renaming, a followup will remove it.

Needed-By: I2dd2075e41680d7b85d574575a19531599dabf5e
Change-Id: Id2aed659c1fcb7333b7efa4dc0a019d21bdcd51a

subject: Fix the bug that couldn't create a receiver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-20 06:27:11.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/objects/fields.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/objects/test_fields.py'], 'message': 'Fix the bug that couldn't create a receiver

When I create a receiver for a cluster,there has
failed with the error message "HttpException:
Internal Server Error"

Then I found there has not the function get_schema()
in ClusterActionName class and ReceiverType class,
so that raise NotImplementedError() from the class
FieldType of oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py.

Then I add the get_schema() in ClusterActionName and
ReceiverType and fix this bug.

Closes-Bug: #1744426
Change-Id: Ie29e1dffdedb37b117ec698fba434084f5d5f831
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the bug that couldn't create a receiver

When I create a receiver for a cluster,there has
failed with the error message "HttpException:
Internal Server Error"

Then I found there has not the function get_schema()
in ClusterActionName class and ReceiverType class,
so that raise NotImplementedError() from the class
FieldType of oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py.

Then I add the get_schema() in ClusterActionName and
ReceiverType and fix this bug.

Closes-Bug: #1744426
Change-Id: Ie29e1dffdedb37b117ec698fba434084f5d5f831

Having openstack/__init__.py referencing pbr is causing some problems
sometimes when invoking sdk apis. This patch propose using the version
definition from version module under openstack/.

This is a follow up of 2f05a3d0667efa07004c71e13217f1ed6d95b198.

commit_message:
Use version definition from openstack.version

Having openstack/__init__.py referencing pbr is causing some problems
sometimes when invoking sdk apis. This patch propose using the version
definition from version module under openstack/.

This is a follow up of 2f05a3d0667efa07004c71e13217f1ed6d95b198.

Change-Id: I3117becd0e91514447a426f2fec4d133dd11f404

commit_message:
Remove hack for ubuntu cloud archive

There is a hack here to set up ubuntu cloud archive, pinning it to
mirror.dfw.rax.openstack.org. The mirror-info role seems to be doing
this correctly now though, so let's remove the hack and let things work
normally.

Change-Id: I283cb3452245b64e9492806f06404b484f21c358
