commit_message:
Add restart to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the restart command

The trove command restart is now:
    openstack database instance restart

Change-Id: I24eeb001d27eae39be5c33650e9bc04287053c8c
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Add tempest-stress project repo

tempest-stress is to perform stress testing of cloud
using tempest. This framework used to be in tempest
earlier but due to tempest scope it had been moved
out of tempest tree.

During queens PTG (even earlier) we discussed to make
it in separate repo.

Needed-By: Ib6fb2eac8568f6e86aae24782bfa6d9cca4fe54c

Change-Id: I063303642f5c99e4ca95d0e02c2360a003688ad6

commit_message:
Add networking-generic-switch-tempest-plugin repo

n-g-s was recently added to baremetal projects [0]
We would like to move tempest code to tempest-plugin.

commit_message:
Make meta.find_best_address() more generic

This function now can choose address family with socket.getaddrinfo()
method and there is no need to pass address family as argument to it.

Task: 6213

commit_message:
Make floating IP to be prefered over fixed when looking for IP

We can assume that floating IP is public IP address in clouds so
floating IPs should be checked first if they can be used to
connect to instance.

subject: Install OpenStack client as requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-21 10:23:07.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Install OpenStack client as requirement

Last part of deploying is running 'tools/init-runonce' script which uses
'openstack' client script.

There is a check is 'openstack' client installed but no
version/functionality check. And this is a problem if there is system
wide python-openstackclient installed in old version (like 3.2.1 in
Debian 'stretch'). Script will finish despite generating bunch of errors
and final deployment will lack networking.

Change-Id: I70a9c5ed3a6ef671affb01b1a87a799e23d6b0e2
"}]
commit_message:
Install OpenStack client as requirement

Last part of deploying is running 'tools/init-runonce' script which uses
'openstack' client script.

There is a check is 'openstack' client installed but no
version/functionality check. And this is a problem if there is system
wide python-openstackclient installed in old version (like 3.2.1 in
Debian 'stretch'). Script will finish despite generating bunch of errors
and final deployment will lack networking.

Change-Id: I70a9c5ed3a6ef671affb01b1a87a799e23d6b0e2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 8246, 'name': 'Qiming Teng', 'email': 'tengqm@outlook.com', 'username': 'tengqm'}, {'_account_id': 8257, 'name': 'Brian Curtin', 'email': 'brian@python.org', 'username': 'briancurtin'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-06-24 10:27:36.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add Constraints support

Constraints is the mechanism that our CI and deployers use to reduce
introduce new libraries into OpenStack in a controlled fashion, ensure
co-installability across the entire OpenStack code base and removed
known bad library releases from consideration.

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove openstacksdk.

This work is part of a larger effort from the requirements management
team to enable flexibility in our requirements management while still
documenting and enforcing co-installability.

Change-Id: I72da07d0afd63c3c00805475f8d440c68db704dd
"}]
commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Constraints is the mechanism that our CI and deployers use to reduce
introduce new libraries into OpenStack in a controlled fashion, ensure
co-installability across the entire OpenStack code base and removed
known bad library releases from consideration.

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove openstacksdk.

This work is part of a larger effort from the requirements management
team to enable flexibility in our requirements management while still
documenting and enforcing co-installability.

Change-Id: I72da07d0afd63c3c00805475f8d440c68db704dd

subject: Invert the attribute mapping
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2018-01-19 15:05:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/compute/v2/keypair.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/compute/v2/test_keypair.py', 'openstack/key_manager/v1/secret.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_resource2.py', 'openstack/resource2.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/limits.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_limits.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/key_manager/v1/test_secret.py'], 'message': "Invert the attribute mapping

requests returns headers in a CaseInsensitiveDict because Headers are
case insensitive. Unfortunately, that only applies to keys, and our
current attribute mapping that we use to consume values from payloads is
{client_name: server_name}, which means we have to go through
shenanigans to get the comparison right.

Invert the mapping returned by _get_mapping and update the logic to
deal with the inversion.

While we're at it, remove _filter_component, as _consume_attrs already
does the same thing and handles the case sensitivity properly.

Change-Id: Ice38cc31635a364839472248f3814b0c8f65bfe1
"}]
commit_message:
Invert the attribute mapping

requests returns headers in a CaseInsensitiveDict because Headers are
case insensitive. Unfortunately, that only applies to keys, and our
current attribute mapping that we use to consume values from payloads is
{client_name: server_name}, which means we have to go through
shenanigans to get the comparison right.

Invert the mapping returned by _get_mapping and update the logic to
deal with the inversion.

While we're at it, remove _filter_component, as _consume_attrs already
does the same thing and handles the case sensitivity properly.

Change-Id: Ice38cc31635a364839472248f3814b0c8f65bfe1

commit_message:
log: augment json records

The ContextFormatter gathers more information about the request than
the JSONFormatter, which is rather opposite to what one might expect.
This patch pulls that logic out into a separate method allowing it to
be reused.

Change-Id: I69063d687648343552e66e47e1e9a55b37eb24c2
Closes-Bug: #1564931

commit_message:
Remove deprecated config options 'resources_prefix'

Config option 'resources_prefix' was deprecated. It is
used by only manila plugin which fix has been commited.

This commit removes this config option and hardcode the
resource prefix as 'tempest'

Change-Id: Idce7af97fe6647e3095b2b626fbacb3446694fbc
Depends-On: I9c140b3a9efabeced7fc26cb1f169ebe6789d88b

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: I2c79aceb98934cda962dcaf13db896d7f55086b8

commit_message:
nimble: handle unicode strings in volume create

currently nimble cinder driver doesn't handle unicode strings
for display_name and display_description

Change-Id: Ic94cbc50d5761c7fc67d2973bed70c70cf6bf769
Closes-Bug: 1732812
(cherry picked from commit 23ac0ab4edd38b91b0c21d5c9e81cd1a7bdddc55)

subject: Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-18 15:20:49.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_manila_handlers.py', 'src/reactive/manila_handlers.py'], 'message': "Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I6e025438bacd17dfb2a6f61fb8ca274187009c57
"}]
commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I6e025438bacd17dfb2a6f61fb8ca274187009c57

commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

Note: cherry-picked from master at b902df7e0e

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I192b74ce0e50a3aa796071a88ebdd9fda4c0fff7

commit_message:

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

commit_message:
Fix api-ref for v3 volume group types

This patch is mainly to fix api-ref for v3 volume group types,
including:

1. add description and example for the API: show defaut group type
2. fix parameters: 'is_public' and 'description'
3. remove unused sample file: group-type-show-request.json

Change-Id: I29f160d8ed24473debb345b4ea91ee0545d711b1

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: Ia3c3db073136fd491749cb02895012e97650592f

commit_message:
Add events and resources for L3 flavors.

To address the callbacks in L3 flavor drivers for OpenDaylight
new event and resources are added to handle router request.
They are introduced initially in neutron [1]. but neutron-lib
is the right place to have them.

[1].https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523257/

Change-Id: I1e72ee843851004d26410a90da4030ab3b024741

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-19 16:32:33.000000000', 'files': ['common/deploy-steps.j2'], 'message': 'Fix server post deploy step with config-download

Due to a misplaced endfor in the j2 template, the deployments.yaml
playbook was only included for the first role. The bogus task playbook
was rendered as:

  - hosts: overcloud
    name: Server Post Deployments
    gather_facts: no
    any_errors_fatal: yes
    tasks:
      - include: Controller/deployments.yaml
        vars:
          force: false
        when: role_name == 'Controller'
        with_items: "{{ Controller_post_deployments|default([]) }}"
    tags:
      - overcloud
      - post_deploy_steps
      - include: Compute/deployments.yaml
        vars:
          force: false
        when: role_name == 'Compute'
        with_items: "{{ Compute_post_deployments|default([]) }}"
    tags:
      - overcloud
      - post_deploy_steps

Change-Id: I625fcaa7c4dcb4f99f30b9d6def293154f4eb7ec
'}]
commit_message:
Fix server post deploy step with config-download

Due to a misplaced endfor in the j2 template, the deployments.yaml
playbook was only included for the first role. The bogus task playbook
was rendered as:

  - hosts: overcloud
    name: Server Post Deployments
    gather_facts: no
    any_errors_fatal: yes
    tasks:
      - include: Controller/deployments.yaml
        vars:
          force: false
        when: role_name == 'Controller'
        with_items: "{{ Controller_post_deployments|default([]) }}"
    tags:
      - overcloud
      - post_deploy_steps
      - include: Compute/deployments.yaml
        vars:
          force: false
        when: role_name == 'Compute'
        with_items: "{{ Compute_post_deployments|default([]) }}"
    tags:
      - overcloud
      - post_deploy_steps

Change-Id: I625fcaa7c4dcb4f99f30b9d6def293154f4eb7ec

commit_message:
Add log-enable to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the log-enable command

The trove command log-enable is now:
    openstack database log enable

Change-Id: Ia5bb395264946f79673970336e4c1f23857bb77d
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-12-27 01:43:27.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/services.py', 'doc/source/admin/index.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/report-backend-state-in-service-list-1e4ee5a2c623671e.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_services.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/api_version_request.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst', 'doc/source/admin/blockstorage-report-backend-state.rst', 'cinder/api/microversions.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': "Report backend state in service list

Currently, Cinder couldn't report backend state to service,
operators only know that cinder-volume process is up,
but isn't aware of if the backend storage device is ok.
Users still can create volume and go to fail over and over again.

This bp propose to get the backend state from driver directly,
operators or management system could query this via service list.

This function will improve the maintenance ability for Cinder.

Change-Id: I561dca3ef7c1901401621bc112389dbd178a907e
Implements: blueprint report-backend-state-in-service-list
"}]
commit_message:
Report backend state in service list

Currently, Cinder couldn't report backend state to service,
operators only know that cinder-volume process is up,
but isn't aware of if the backend storage device is ok.
Users still can create volume and go to fail over and over again.

This bp propose to get the backend state from driver directly,
operators or management system could query this via service list.

This function will improve the maintenance ability for Cinder.

Change-Id: I561dca3ef7c1901401621bc112389dbd178a907e
Implements: blueprint report-backend-state-in-service-list

commit_message:
Remove obsolete tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been reintegrated into tempest and this repository
already uses tempest instead of tempest-lib. Replace requirements for
tempest-lib with requirements for tempest.

See also
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/qa-specs/specs/tempest/implemented/reintegrate-tempest-lib.html

Change-Id: Ic6eeaf151dcdcc011a4d941d3f605b7dba265f04

commit_message:
Delete project from group_vars

The "project" in group_vars always none.So all containers binds info like
"/etc/kolla//mariadb".There are more than one '/'  between "/etc/kolla" and
service name.

Change-Id: I2b0dcd984975ca356c88475a89199ade85f4662d

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-20 09:22:49.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-force-delete-to-osc-dfff1db4da937415.yaml', 'troveclient/osc/v1/database_clusters.py', 'troveclient/tests/osc/v1/test_database_clusters.py', 'setup.cfg', 'troveclient/osc/v1/database_instances.py', 'troveclient/tests/osc/v1/test_database_instances.py'], 'message': 'Add force-delete to OSC

This change adds database support for the python-openstackclient
project for the force-delete and cluster-force-delete commands.

The trove command force-delete is now:
    openstack database instance force delete
The trove command cluster-force-delete is now:
    openstack database cluster force delete

Change-Id: I919678ca6b06d3b5762eac1990cc1fbf0e149d7c
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add force-delete to OSC

This change adds database support for the python-openstackclient
project for the force-delete and cluster-force-delete commands.

The trove command force-delete is now:
    openstack database instance force delete
The trove command cluster-force-delete is now:
    openstack database cluster force delete

Change-Id: I919678ca6b06d3b5762eac1990cc1fbf0e149d7c
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add quota commands to OSC

This change adds database support for the python-openstackclient
project for the quota-show and quota-update commands.

The trove command quota-show is now:
    openstack database quota show
The trove command quota-update is now:
    openstack database quota update

Change-Id: I989b360fd358004e1a2378bdc3a573450baff2f3
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

subject: Use log debug instead of warning
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 15054, 'name': 'wangxiyuan', 'email': 'wangxiyuan1007@gmail.com', 'username': 'wangxiyuan'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27386, 'name': 'gaofei', 'email': 'gao.fei@inspur.com', 'username': 'gaofei'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-03 11:52:51.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/auth/controllers.py'], 'message': "Use log debug instead of warning

Setting the default project is merely provided for convenience,
does not need exist project and grant any actual authorization
on it, This shouldn't be a warning.

At the same time, if the log message exposes to the users,
they know the identity authentication has already passed and
the used password is valid, which could be useful to an attacker.
Log warnings is not necessarily as locked down as debug log,
I think this would be fine as a debug log.

Change-Id: I85ed00ad3d08ed52b159d4da1526a006d72d9677
"}]
commit_message:
Use log debug instead of warning

Setting the default project is merely provided for convenience,
does not need exist project and grant any actual authorization
on it, This shouldn't be a warning.

At the same time, if the log message exposes to the users,
they know the identity authentication has already passed and
the used password is valid, which could be useful to an attacker.
Log warnings is not necessarily as locked down as debug log,
I think this would be fine as a debug log.

Change-Id: I85ed00ad3d08ed52b159d4da1526a006d72d9677

subject: Fix usage of socket.AF_INET constant in meta.find_best_address
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-20 21:21:21.000000000', 'files': ['shade/meta.py'], 'message': 'Fix usage of socket.AF_INET constant in meta.find_best_address

In commit [1] additional check was added to check if checking address
family is IPv4 or IPv6.
Unfortunatelly there was used socket.AF_INET4 contant which not exists
in socket module.
AF_INET should be used instead and this patch fixes this.

[1] Ida5099278363dc4a527bb488c83883a1d2377f6b
Story: 2001475

Change-Id: Ib50422231d23813e3679bf5390ab9b49afec5db7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of socket.AF_INET constant in meta.find_best_address

In commit [1] additional check was added to check if checking address
family is IPv4 or IPv6.
Unfortunatelly there was used socket.AF_INET4 contant which not exists
in socket module.
AF_INET should be used instead and this patch fixes this.

[1] Ida5099278363dc4a527bb488c83883a1d2377f6b
Story: 2001475

Change-Id: Ib50422231d23813e3679bf5390ab9b49afec5db7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-11 13:33:58.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/trunks/steps/trunk-subports.controller.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/trunks/actions/create.action.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/trunks/actions/edit.action.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/trunks/steps/trunk-parent-port.controller.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/trunks/steps/trunk-parent-port.controller.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/trunks/steps/trunk-subports.controller.js'], 'message': "Trunks panel: simplify code for easier testing

The crossHide boolean flag was never a necessary part of the trunks
panel. The only downside of not having it is that we expose a data
structure between the step controllers even when that's not needed
(when crossHide previously was false).

Eliminating the if/else simplifies coverage testing in the followup
patch.

Change-Id: Id7b51997b48d2dd91057975c2fcfb2c40c33aa51
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-trunk-ui
"}]
commit_message:
Trunks panel: simplify code for easier testing

The crossHide boolean flag was never a necessary part of the trunks
panel. The only downside of not having it is that we expose a data
structure between the step controllers even when that's not needed
(when crossHide previously was false).

Eliminating the if/else simplifies coverage testing in the followup
patch.

Change-Id: Id7b51997b48d2dd91057975c2fcfb2c40c33aa51
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-trunk-ui

subject: Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-19 15:05:28.000000000', 'files': ['src/actions/run-tempest.py', 'src/lib/charm/openstack/tempest.py'], 'message': "Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I704d1bfe7c51880c38482667a6e1fcccb8059357
"}]
commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I704d1bfe7c51880c38482667a6e1fcccb8059357

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-19 13:16:41.000000000', 'files': ['src/lib/charm/openstack/designate.py', 'src/reactive/designate_handlers.py', 'src/tests/gate-basic-zesty-ocata'], 'message': "Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

Note: cherry-picked from master at e779167bf5

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I2f1de103595ec502d9b55df42855a6eda1801b75
"}]
commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

Note: cherry-picked from master at e779167bf5

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I2f1de103595ec502d9b55df42855a6eda1801b75

adding iSER connector for PPC64

Power architecture supports iSCSI Extensions for RDMA (iSER) protocol.

subject: Make multinode fedora gate non-voting
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-19 10:12:53.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Make multinode fedora gate non-voting

This patchset sets the fedora multinode gate non-voting until outstanding
gate issues are resolved, so they not blocking future patch sets.

Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}]
commit_message:
Make multinode fedora gate non-voting

This patchset sets the fedora multinode gate non-voting until outstanding
gate issues are resolved, so they not blocking future patch sets.

Change-Id: I8ad06f5456b83ff3f618032a8ad0212de5e7a2c1
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-12-26 03:51:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/validation/parameter_types.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/types_manage.py', 'cinder/api/schemas/volume_types.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_types_manage.py'], 'message': "V3 jsonschema validation: Volume-types

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Volume-types API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/types
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/types/{volume_type_id}

Made changes to unit tests to pass body as keyword argument as wsgi
calls action method [1] and passes body as keyword argument.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py#L997

Change-Id: Ibacf0acd16d3a3210289244fe2b99ebf5c5dd4ec
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation
"}]
commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: Volume-types

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Volume-types API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/types
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/types/{volume_type_id}

Made changes to unit tests to pass body as keyword argument as wsgi
calls action method [1] and passes body as keyword argument.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py#L997

Change-Id: Ibacf0acd16d3a3210289244fe2b99ebf5c5dd4ec
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the resize-volume command

The trove command resize-volume is now:
    openstack database instance resize volume

Change-Id: If2413a605d294db0b0ee9c7aa49fbb1c929ebcd0
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient
'}]
commit_message:
Add resize-volume to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the resize-volume command

The trove command resize-volume is now:
    openstack database instance resize volume

Change-Id: If2413a605d294db0b0ee9c7aa49fbb1c929ebcd0
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

Fix api.keystone.is_cloud_admin/is_domain_admin handling with new policies

policy.

[{'number': 28, 'created': '2017-12-27 10:50:19.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/journal/worker.py', 'networking_odl/tests/unit/journal/test_journal.py', 'networking_odl/journal/journal.py', 'networking_odl/ml2/mech_driver_v2.py'], 'message': 'Add SIGHUP handling to journal periodic processing

It is a common practice in *NIX to handle SIGHUP to restart a service
gracefully or reload configurations. This allows the worker to be
reloaded and gives way to future enhancement where we can trigger
journal related tasks externally (ie: full sync, maintenance, etc).

Even though signal handling is setup by neutron-lib, without this patch
SIGHUP is not handled at all by this worker. It just results on a crash
of the process. This patch adds the necessary logic to allow to restart
it without crashing the process.

Change-Id: I4117b3901c7687d86dbf00152fc72b496d7cdbc8
'}]
commit_message:
Add SIGHUP handling to journal periodic processing

It is a common practice in *NIX to handle SIGHUP to restart a service
gracefully or reload configurations. This allows the worker to be
reloaded and gives way to future enhancement where we can trigger
journal related tasks externally (ie: full sync, maintenance, etc).

Even though signal handling is setup by neutron-lib, without this patch
SIGHUP is not handled at all by this worker. It just results on a crash
of the process. This patch adds the necessary logic to allow to restart
it without crashing the process.

Change-Id: I4117b3901c7687d86dbf00152fc72b496d7cdbc8

subject: Upgrade Postgresql support to v9.6
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-19 23:00:28.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/pgsql_query.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/service.py', 'trove/templates/postgresql/config.template', 'integration/scripts/files/elements/ubuntu-postgresql/install.d/30-postgresql', 'integration/scripts/trovestack', 'integration/scripts/files/elements/fedora-postgresql/install.d/10-postgresql', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/replication/experimental/postgresql_impl.py'], 'message': 'Upgrade Postgresql support to v9.6

Modified existing Postgresql elements to support v9.6.
This change will no longer support pg<9.6, so "wal_log_hints"
is supported by default. Remove "checkpoint_segments" from
config.template because the parameter is no longer supported
from 9.5. By defult, "trovestack kick-start postgresql" will
create a pg-9.6 image. The steps in "30-postgresql" has been
tested in ubuntu trusty. Since yum.postgresql.org is no longer support
fedora-22[1], trovestack use fedora-27 by default, and steps in
"10-postgresql" has been tested too.
Releated commits: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409524/
[1] https://yum.postgresql.org/9.6/fedora/
Closes-bug: 1649084

Change-Id: I65d93635ad45838522abed014825d1f7e567c30c
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrade Postgresql support to v9.6

Modified existing Postgresql elements to support v9.6.
This change will no longer support pg<9.6, so "wal_log_hints"
is supported by default. Remove "checkpoint_segments" from
config.template because the parameter is no longer supported
from 9.5. By defult, "trovestack kick-start postgresql" will
create a pg-9.6 image. The steps in "30-postgresql" has been
tested in ubuntu trusty. Since yum.postgresql.org is no longer support
fedora-22[1], trovestack use fedora-27 by default, and steps in
"10-postgresql" has been tested too.
Releated commits: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409524/
[1] https://yum.postgresql.org/9.6/fedora/
Closes-bug: 1649084

Change-Id: I65d93635ad45838522abed014825d1f7e567c30c

commit_message:
trunk: Create vxlan network when testing inherit

The inherit segmentation type fails only when parent network has a not
supported network type. In case default is a supported one, e.g. vlan,
then inherit correctly returns vlan as subport segmentation type.

This patch forces to use vxlan as a network type for test validating
inherit option.

Cherry-picked from change Idf6935e4da426ff50457483a8f08a9ae3e403f75
from neutron_tempest_plugin

Change-Id: Idf6935e4da426ff50457483a8f08a9ae3e403f75
Closes-bug: #1739227

subject: Fix nested template genearation when attribute path is not string
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-01-19 05:15:47.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/autoscaling/test_heat_scaling_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_resource_chain.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/resource_chain.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/resource_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_resource_group.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/autoscaling_group.py'], 'message': "Fix nested template genearation when attribute path is not string

When determining attributes to cache, we seem to be assuming the
paths to be strings. If there are resource references in outputs
it would be None during validation.

As we've the same code snippet in all group resources
ex. ResourceGroup, ResourceChain and heat AutoScalingGroup, this
fixes it in all those places.

Change-Id: I36d623b183d01632041113f7bff63bf255f5d53c
Closes-Bug: #1719603
"}]
commit_message:
Fix nested template genearation when attribute path is not string

When determining attributes to cache, we seem to be assuming the
paths to be strings. If there are resource references in outputs
it would be None during validation.

As we've the same code snippet in all group resources
ex. ResourceGroup, ResourceChain and heat AutoScalingGroup, this
fixes it in all those places.

Change-Id: I36d623b183d01632041113f7bff63bf255f5d53c
Closes-Bug: #1719603

commit_message:
Disable security group rule when create port

Use "driver_handles_share_servers=True" backend driver.
When create service neutron port to connect with service instances,
we should set the port security group is disable, to prevent be added
the default security group in neutron. Because some cases the default
security group would lead to the port can not connect with the service
instances.

Change-Id: Ib13e4f80c5a54b2b863b511ebb6e8f82700a3639
Closes-Bug:#1720283

subject: Define singletons to represent min and max shard range bounds
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-01-19 11:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py', 'swift/container/backend.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Define singletons to represent min and max shard range bounds

Previously the min lower bound and max upper bound of a ShardRange
were both represented by the empty string. This led to complex
conditional statements. For example:

- when both lower and upper were unbounded then it was not possible to
  simply check that lower != upper

- it was not possible to simply check if one shard range's upper was
  less than another, because the empty string is always less than any
  other string.

Those kinds of tests therefore needed confusing extra logic to first
test if the upper existed at all before making the expected
comparison.

With this patch the min lower and max upper bounds are represented by
singleton objects that have the property that ShardRange.MIN is less
than any other name and ShardRange.MAX is greater than any other
name. Consequently it is now safe to write:

  if sr1.upper > sr2.upper:
      print 'sr1 upper is definitely greater than sr2.upper'

even when sr1.upper is unbounded.

ShardRange.MIN and ShardRange.MAX both use the empty string as their
string representation so they can still be serialized in the same way
as before. Also, ShardRange.lower and ShardRange.upper can still
be set with the empty string but internally this is converted to the
appropriate singleton.

Also, add properties and setters for ShardRange lower and upper
attributes to implement checking.

Change-Id: I00a45b5a29531cb06df28b18e88e38ab6285b5b9
"}]
commit_message:
Define singletons to represent min and max shard range bounds

Previously the min lower bound and max upper bound of a ShardRange
were both represented by the empty string. This led to complex
conditional statements. For example:

- when both lower and upper were unbounded then it was not possible to
  simply check that lower != upper

- it was not possible to simply check if one shard range's upper was
  less than another, because the empty string is always less than any
  other string.

Those kinds of tests therefore needed confusing extra logic to first
test if the upper existed at all before making the expected
comparison.

With this patch the min lower and max upper bounds are represented by
singleton objects that have the property that ShardRange.MIN is less
than any other name and ShardRange.MAX is greater than any other
name. Consequently it is now safe to write:

  if sr1.upper > sr2.upper:
      print 'sr1 upper is definitely greater than sr2.upper'

even when sr1.upper is unbounded.

ShardRange.MIN and ShardRange.MAX both use the empty string as their
string representation so they can still be serialized in the same way
as before. Also, ShardRange.lower and ShardRange.upper can still
be set with the empty string but internally this is converted to the
appropriate singleton.

Also, add properties and setters for ShardRange lower and upper
attributes to implement checking.

Change-Id: I00a45b5a29531cb06df28b18e88e38ab6285b5b9

commit_message:
Support function package md5

User can specify md5sum for the package when creating function that
Qinling could check. User can also check by herself when downloading
function package.

Change-Id: Ib3d37cd92bd2ed7018f5a4825a5323b2652948c9
Implements: blueprint qinling-function-package-md5

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2018-01-19 15:43:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py'], 'message': 'SchedulerReportClient.set_traits_for_provider

Introduce SchedulerReportClient.set_traits_for_provider, which accepts a
provider UUID and list of traits to push back to the placement API.  On
success, the local ProviderTree cache is updated appropriately.  On
failure, an exception is raised.  If the failure was a conflict (409),
the exception is a subclass of PlacementAPIConflict (see below) so that
the caller may decide to refresh and retry.

This change also introduces the _ensure_traits helper, which makes sure
a given set of traits exists in the placement service.

Per design [1], we want consumers of SchedulerReportClient to be able to
detect placement API conflict errors (HTTP 409), as distinct from other
errors.  Such consumers (the resource tracker) may respond to conflicts
by redriving the operation in progress, whereas other exceptions will be
allowed to bubble up.  PlacementAPIConflict will be the (base) class of
exceptions raised in response to placement 409s for which we want to
allow this kind of behavior.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_scheduler/2018/nova_scheduler.2018-01-08-14.00.log.html#l-251

Change-Id: I9d9b4a5cb5f6c5d255c00e22923728892c37383f
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
blueprint: ironic-driver-traits
'}]
commit_message:
SchedulerReportClient.set_traits_for_provider

Introduce SchedulerReportClient.set_traits_for_provider, which accepts a
provider UUID and list of traits to push back to the placement API.  On
success, the local ProviderTree cache is updated appropriately.  On
failure, an exception is raised.  If the failure was a conflict (409),
the exception is a subclass of PlacementAPIConflict (see below) so that
the caller may decide to refresh and retry.

This change also introduces the _ensure_traits helper, which makes sure
a given set of traits exists in the placement service.

Per design [1], we want consumers of SchedulerReportClient to be able to
detect placement API conflict errors (HTTP 409), as distinct from other
errors.  Such consumers (the resource tracker) may respond to conflicts
by redriving the operation in progress, whereas other exceptions will be
allowed to bubble up.  PlacementAPIConflict will be the (base) class of
exceptions raised in response to placement 409s for which we want to
allow this kind of behavior.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_scheduler/2018/nova_scheduler.2018-01-08-14.00.log.html#l-251

Change-Id: I9d9b4a5cb5f6c5d255c00e22923728892c37383f
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
blueprint: ironic-driver-traits

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2018-01-19 15:43:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py', 'nova/compute/provider_tree.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_provider_tree.py'], 'message': 'ProviderTree.data => ProviderData

An instance of ProviderTree is used to cache resource provider
information in the report client.  We will also use a ProviderTree
instance as the input and output of ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree.
We will then need to compare those two and flush any differences back to
the placement API.  Thus, we need a way to access the details of
individual resource providers in a ProviderTree.

Prior to this patch, provider details were hidden behind a private
_Provider class, and only accessible from ProviderTree via methods that
assumed you already knew the thing you were trying to compare against.

Enter ProviderData, which has all the same attributes as _Provider, but
whose modification is discouraged in various ways (naming,
documentation, and exceptions attempting to set attributes).  The new
ProviderTree.data method returns a ProviderData of the specified
_Provider.

Change-Id: I832bda86d9a6f9924d28dcdbd7091ed466c19196
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
'}]
commit_message:
ProviderTree.data => ProviderData

An instance of ProviderTree is used to cache resource provider
information in the report client.  We will also use a ProviderTree
instance as the input and output of ComputeDriver.update_provider_tree.
We will then need to compare those two and flush any differences back to
the placement API.  Thus, we need a way to access the details of
individual resource providers in a ProviderTree.

Prior to this patch, provider details were hidden behind a private
_Provider class, and only accessible from ProviderTree via methods that
assumed you already knew the thing you were trying to compare against.

Enter ProviderData, which has all the same attributes as _Provider, but
whose modification is discouraged in various ways (naming,
documentation, and exceptions attempting to set attributes).  The new
ProviderTree.data method returns a ProviderData of the specified
_Provider.

Change-Id: I832bda86d9a6f9924d28dcdbd7091ed466c19196
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

commit_message:
Pass multiattach flag to reserve_block_device_name

This is similar to how we use reserve_block_device_name
for tagged attach in that we can fail fast in the API if
trying to attach a multiattach volume to an instance on
a compute host that can't support it, either because the
compute service is too old or the virt driver doesn't
support the multiattach capability yet.

A later change will build on this to pass the multiattach
flag from the API when a multiattach volume is requested
in a new microversion, similar to how 2.49 works.

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: Ieec2bbd8a23c861c89bf9922517fa6a5562f1937

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2018-01-17 23:41:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/test_volume_retype.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/test_volume.py', 'doc/source/admin/index.rst', 'doc/source/admin/blockstorage-volume-multiattach.rst', 'cinder/api/openstack/api_version_request.py', 'cinder/api/microversions.py', 'cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': "Enable multiattach capability

This patch adds the ability to create multiple attachments
for a single volume.  This change requires that a volume
either be created with a special volume-type that includes
extra-specs indicating the requirement for multiattach
capabilities from the backend:
    `extra_specs: {'multiattach': '<is> True'}`

or that an available volume is retyped to the specified
multiattach type.

What the patch does is pretty simple:
1.  On volume create
    Inspect the associated volume-type to see if it includes
    the multiattach capability, if it does and
    scheduling/creation is succesful; then we set the
    multiattach attribute on the volume to True

2.  On volume retype
    We verify that if the retype involves multiattach
    capability that it's allowed  and check policy.

    After retype, again we set/update the multiattach
    attribute of the volume appropriately to match
    the newly specified type.

Note that we do NOT do anything to enforce the volume is
formatted with a shared filesystem!  Attempting to use
this feature with a standard ext4 filesystem will lead to
one or more of your attachments erroring out and being
converted to read only mode.

blueprint: bp/multi-attach-v3-attach

Change-Id: Ic8a8ba2271d6ed672b694d3991dabd46bd9a69f4
"}]
commit_message:
Enable multiattach capability

This patch adds the ability to create multiple attachments
for a single volume.  This change requires that a volume
either be created with a special volume-type that includes
extra-specs indicating the requirement for multiattach
capabilities from the backend:
    `extra_specs: {'multiattach': '<is> True'}`

or that an available volume is retyped to the specified
multiattach type.

What the patch does is pretty simple:
1.  On volume create
    Inspect the associated volume-type to see if it includes
    the multiattach capability, if it does and
    scheduling/creation is succesful; then we set the
    multiattach attribute on the volume to True

2.  On volume retype
    We verify that if the retype involves multiattach
    capability that it's allowed  and check policy.

    After retype, again we set/update the multiattach
    attribute of the volume appropriately to match
    the newly specified type.

Note that we do NOT do anything to enforce the volume is
formatted with a shared filesystem!  Attempting to use
this feature with a standard ext4 filesystem will lead to
one or more of your attachments erroring out and being
converted to read only mode.

blueprint: bp/multi-attach-v3-attach

Change-Id: Ic8a8ba2271d6ed672b694d3991dabd46bd9a69f4

subject: Correctly set nova_cinder_rbd_inuse in os_nova execution
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-19 18:57:35.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/common-playbooks/nova.yml'], 'message': 'Correctly set nova_cinder_rbd_inuse in os_nova execution

This line is already present in Pike and master, however it was
omitted by mistake in Ocata. This means that when Cinder uses RBD
backends, but no RBD backend is used for Nova's instance backing,
the ceph_client role will be skipped when deploying the compute host.

When this happens, instances trying to attach volumes will receive
an error stating that the libvirt secret store does not contain the
RBD secret:
"libvirtError: Secret not found: no secret with matching uuid"

By passing this nova_cinder_rbd_inuse boolean to the Nova role based
on the set_fact above in this playbook, ceph_client will deploy the
ceph libraries and secret to the compute host when it is needed
for volume attachments to work.

Change-Id: I4a673c4966e36ccc88392ff9e103da7806248e3c
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly set nova_cinder_rbd_inuse in os_nova execution

This line is already present in Pike and master, however it was
omitted by mistake in Ocata. This means that when Cinder uses RBD
backends, but no RBD backend is used for Nova's instance backing,
the ceph_client role will be skipped when deploying the compute host.

When this happens, instances trying to attach volumes will receive
an error stating that the libvirt secret store does not contain the
RBD secret:
"libvirtError: Secret not found: no secret with matching uuid"

By passing this nova_cinder_rbd_inuse boolean to the Nova role based
on the set_fact above in this playbook, ceph_client will deploy the
ceph libraries and secret to the compute host when it is needed
for volume attachments to work.

Change-Id: I4a673c4966e36ccc88392ff9e103da7806248e3c

commit_message:
Add uuid field in ContainerAction object

In etcd, we use 'uuid' to filter container_action instead of 'id'
field. Updating ContainerAction by adding uuid field to support
container_action etcd api.

Change-Id: Ib716db77f8fbc0adb8597b9c0c7c82efa921ab05
Closes-Bug: #1734550

commit_message:
Modify docker network naming schema to fix bug/1734550

This bug occurred because there are two docker networks created to represent
one neutron net.[1]
This patch modify the docker network naming schema in _get_docker_network_name.
project_id is not needed in naming schema, because neutron_net_id is a unique
id over neutron networks and also docker networks.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/zun/+bug/1734550/comments/0

Change-Id: Ib716db77f8fbc0adb8597b9c0c7c82efa921ab05
Closes-Bug: #1734550

subject: Empty keystone.conf apache2 vhost
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-19 12:12:57.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/keystone.pp'], 'message': 'Empty keystone.conf apache2 vhost

Normally the keystone.conf is removed to make sure the
default configuration provided in the keystone package
for Ubuntu is skipped. This will cause issues when upgrading
the keystone package since the keystone.postinst script when
upgrading will look for that file. [1]

Instead we should make sure this file is empty which will make
sure upgrading the package is possible without manual intervention.

This does not affect gate per se but will act as a guideline on how
it should be used.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/keystone/+bug/1737697

Closes-Bug: #1737697
Change-Id: Ia69a11614a1fdd32a4903b47427fe3e6a48f9205
'}]
commit_message:
Empty keystone.conf apache2 vhost

Normally the keystone.conf is removed to make sure the
default configuration provided in the keystone package
for Ubuntu is skipped. This will cause issues when upgrading
the keystone package since the keystone.postinst script when
upgrading will look for that file. [1]

Instead we should make sure this file is empty which will make
sure upgrading the package is possible without manual intervention.

This does not affect gate per se but will act as a guideline on how
it should be used.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/keystone/+bug/1737697

Closes-Bug: #1737697
Change-Id: Ia69a11614a1fdd32a4903b47427fe3e6a48f9205

commit_message:
online_data_migrations: allow passing command line params to migrations

The existing extra_params only works for generic ironic-dbsync arguments
(like --config-file), but not for arguments specific to migrations
(like --max-count).

Related-Bug: #1690185

On hosts that do not have any containers (ie. computes) network bridges
are not needed and may introduce some unwanted overhead. This
configuration was possible until Mitaka, but broke with the
dynamic-address-fact.yml tasks in Newton.

This change checks if the bridge actually exists and otherwise uses the
IP configured in the inventory instead.

Change-Id: I23668429a19f00f520ac18c76254e83708778d5a
(cherry picked from commit ea32c3da767d156dc851abd9d2b5121375b760e8)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid retrieving IP from a missing bridge

On hosts that do not have any containers (ie. computes) network bridges
are not needed and may introduce some unwanted overhead. This
configuration was possible until Mitaka, but broke with the
dynamic-address-fact.yml tasks in Newton.

This change checks if the bridge actually exists and otherwise uses the
IP configured in the inventory instead.

Change-Id: I23668429a19f00f520ac18c76254e83708778d5a
(cherry picked from commit ea32c3da767d156dc851abd9d2b5121375b760e8)

subject: Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-18 15:01:11.000000000', 'files': ['src/lib/charm/openstack/designate.py', 'src/reactive/designate_handlers.py'], 'message': "Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I0a9ddb5a8870cdf81a553229889f00090e90ab0b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix up to work with 0.6.0 of charms.reactive

charms.reactive deprecates the RelationBase.from_state() class
method.  This is an internal method in charms.reactive and shouldn't
really have been used.

This patch changes to charms.relations.endpoint_from_flag(...) which
essentially does the same thing and will be a more stable API moving
forwards.

Note that from this point on, the library will ONLY work with
charms.reactive 0.6.0 onwards and the modified charms.openstack library.

Change-Id: I0a9ddb5a8870cdf81a553229889f00090e90ab0b

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: allow to set the BGP local_pref

With this change, bagpipe-bgp local API supports setting
the BGP LOCAL_PREF that will be used in the route
for a VM interface.

Change-Id: I70921d3fb5fc27fdac60cab728ab6b9d731453d5
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-18 14:05:35.000000000', 'files': ['docker/horizon/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': "Fix neutron_fwaas_dashboard plugin

Horizon container is not starting because of:

cp: cannot stat '/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/neutron_fwaas_dashboard/enabled/_*[^__].py': No such file or directory

So, this change copies the plugins into
the neutron_fwaas_dashboard python package
directory before they are removed from /usr/share.

Change-Id: Ibb300e0dfcde97135c6dfe536ec945b7839293bd
Related-Bug: 1742947
"}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron_fwaas_dashboard plugin

Horizon container is not starting because of:

cp: cannot stat '/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/neutron_fwaas_dashboard/enabled/_*[^__].py': No such file or directory

So, this change copies the plugins into
the neutron_fwaas_dashboard python package
directory before they are removed from /usr/share.

Change-Id: Ibb300e0dfcde97135c6dfe536ec945b7839293bd
Related-Bug: 1742947

commit_message:
Nova: add spice console

This PS adds spice remote console.
User can choose a console by changing console_kind in values file.
Best practice is to select one or the other to run,
so choosing something other than vnc disables the vnc console.

Change-Id: Ic5d361d5f344b7a078e0c3aeb5f921810101552d

Adds RPC calls for rescue interface

It also adds transitions to/from the rescue-related states.

subject: Don't load resource data for list_outputs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-25 16:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': "Don't load resource data for list_outputs

This RPC call only generates a list of the outputs defined in the template,
not their values, so don't load the resource data needed to calculate the
output values (which can be very slow).

Also, explicitly pass resolve_value=False instead of relying on the default
argument (which is different for format_stack_output() and
format_stack_outputs()), to reduce future confusion.

Change-Id: I79aae94b6552d465db6707cd4a40cd53ff18455b
Closes-Bug: #1719340
"}]
commit_message:
Don't load resource data for list_outputs

This RPC call only generates a list of the outputs defined in the template,
not their values, so don't load the resource data needed to calculate the
output values (which can be very slow).

Also, explicitly pass resolve_value=False instead of relying on the default
argument (which is different for format_stack_output() and
format_stack_outputs()), to reduce future confusion.

Change-Id: I79aae94b6552d465db6707cd4a40cd53ff18455b
Closes-Bug: #1719340

commit_message:
Support power reset command

Some OpenStack installer such as [1] use power reset when switching
from bootstrap kernel to OS installation kernel. So we'd better
implement this.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/admin/projects/openstack/daisycloud-core

Change-Id: I60df3a31c7600d35d50212538fbfffd22bf7c729
Signed-off-by: Zhijiang Hu <hu.zhiiang@zte.com.cn>

rectified, we should disable voting for the job until

to continue to land code and have it reviewed while

commit_message:
Mark multinode job as non-voting

As the mutlinode job is failing and is failing
in ways that cannot currently be easily and cleanly
rectified, we should disable voting for the job until
we are able to fully identify the cause and proper
solution in order to allow the project contributors
to continue to land code and have it reviewed while
we work to resolve the multinode grenade job issues.

Change-Id: If204c7b979baa71b3b9bbb7e79d13741f580ba8b
Related-Bug: #1744139

subject: Add missing capability, breaking volume attachments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-19 19:19:30.000000000', 'files': ['compute_hyperv/nova/driver.py'], 'message': "Add missing capability, breaking volume attachments

A new driver capability has been introduced, specifying if volume
multiattach is supported.

The issue is that our driver doesn't have it yet, so attaching
volumes currently fails with a KeyError:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/647116/

This change adds the missing capability field.

Change-Id: I24a3be98d5b7afd1d56eea9bfca22fbca5c64f42
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing capability, breaking volume attachments

A new driver capability has been introduced, specifying if volume
multiattach is supported.

The issue is that our driver doesn't have it yet, so attaching
volumes currently fails with a KeyError:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/647116/

This change adds the missing capability field.

Change-Id: I24a3be98d5b7afd1d56eea9bfca22fbca5c64f42

commit_message:
Configure ansible's verbosity according to command's verbosity

This relates the ansible-playbook's verbosity according to the verbose
level that's passed in to the overcloud deploy command.

commit_message:
We dont support fwaas in Horizon

By default we are enabling a plugin
not supported by default.

Only in pike, in master is already disabled.

Change-Id: I7dd2d840c4f706799673bb85eb81ede275976d29
Related-Bug: 1742947

commit_message:
Restore OVSIntPort interfaces after OVS restarts

There are 2 cases when OVS is restarted
1. Package Upgrade
2. OVS restart invoked by Puppet

Closes-Bug: 1737182
Change-Id: I69f5f80d1e359be72773e2622e1d3e90922d8b3b
(cherry picked from commit a0a1984cd3b3d8dea65ee7b88c1d026dae60077a)

commit_message:
Octavia post deployment mistral wrapper

This mistral workflow is written in order to run octavia post
deployment (ansible based playbook) from the undercloud machine
while deploying overcloud by heat.
The workflow should be triggered by heat engine in a step
which is after completing octavia deployment (currently step 5).

Change-Id: If07ded033be9f44b7c7a7e09214032fa89a02e77

commit_message:
[WIP] Add network policy

This patch set introduces east-west bound network policy enforcement
for OpenStack-Helm* projects.

                        /\
                       /  |
                       \  o
                   _.-`/`-._
       _         _/         \_         _
      ) `-._   _/  /O\   /O\  \_   _.-` (
     )      `-/    `-'   `-'    \-`      (
     )     _.-|      ___        |-._     (
      )_.-`   \   .-'   `-._    /   `-._(
               \   `-.___.--`  /
                "-._       _.-"

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-20 04:28:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributor/policies/blueprints.rst', 'doc/source/contributor/policies/bugs.rst'], 'message': 'Introduce rfe-confirmed and rfe-triaged tags

Right now we use Launchpad State "Confirmed" and "Triaged" for
the query to generate the agenda of neutron-drivers meetings.
Unfortunately it's often interfered by the gerrit integration.
E.g. A submission of Closed-Bug patch changes the state to "In Progess".

This patch avoids the issue by tweaking the procedure to use a set of
tags instead.

An altenative would be to teach the gerrit integration about our usage.
Or, move to some other systems like storyboard.
But they would require more efforts than this change.

Change-Id: I9becc8052b80a284a4cb336e2da115d28d501720
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce rfe-confirmed and rfe-triaged tags

Right now we use Launchpad State "Confirmed" and "Triaged" for
the query to generate the agenda of neutron-drivers meetings.
Unfortunately it's often interfered by the gerrit integration.
E.g. A submission of Closed-Bug patch changes the state to "In Progess".

This patch avoids the issue by tweaking the procedure to use a set of
tags instead.

An altenative would be to teach the gerrit integration about our usage.
Or, move to some other systems like storyboard.
But they would require more efforts than this change.

Change-Id: I9becc8052b80a284a4cb336e2da115d28d501720

commit_message:
helm-toolkit prometheus service annotation clean up

This adds checks for the fields in the service annotations for
prometheus, similar to the checks made for the pod annotations.
It also moves prometheus annotations under a prometheus: key
under a top-level monitoring tree to allow for other monitoring
mechanisms independent of the endpoints tree

Change-Id: I4be6d6ad8e74e8ca52bd224ceddad785577bf6c7

subject: Prometheus: Disable prometheus enable-admin-api by default
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-18 15:24:38.000000000', 'files': ['prometheus/values.yaml'], 'message': 'Prometheus: Disable prometheus enable-admin-api by default

This disables the Prometheus admin http api by default to fall in
line with the service defaults, as enabling this exposes endpoints
for deleting and modifying time series over http.

Change-Id: I797dce32d625c4c8e927a6b0649dbba0db7f6905
'}]
commit_message:
Prometheus: Disable prometheus enable-admin-api by default

This disables the Prometheus admin http api by default to fall in
line with the service defaults, as enabling this exposes endpoints
for deleting and modifying time series over http.

Change-Id: I797dce32d625c4c8e927a6b0649dbba0db7f6905

commit_message:
Migrate to override_role for volume module (part 1)

Now that override_role has supplanted switch_role (which has
been deprecated) in [0], the RBAC tests need to switch to use
override_role.

This PS switches to override_role for the volume module. This
PS handles the first 4 modules for volume.

This PS also removes unnecessary indexing into response bodies.

[0] I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I1dbe2b17716c98570faa36da578fd489d9d461df

subject: Replace virtualenv-tools by a script
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-01-19 15:10:24.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/heat_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Ic2497f23d0c0a9160fc3fe57ccdb78094d499f83
Partial-Bug: #1741634
"}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Ic2497f23d0c0a9160fc3fe57ccdb78094d499f83
Partial-Bug: #1741634

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2018-01-15 12:29:30.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/contributor/scripts.rst', 'scripts/ansible-role-requirements-editor.py', 'scripts/sources-branch-updater.sh', 'scripts/get-pypi-pkg-version.py', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'scripts/sources-branch-updater-lib.sh', 'scripts/release-yaml-file-prep.py'], 'message': "Fix sources-branch-updater and add docs

Problems resolved:

- Errors relating to 'etc' folders which did not exist in the

- Some repositories were not being excluded from evaluation
  for file/template updates. All appropriate exclusions are
  now implemented.

- If an OSA role repository did not have the required folder
  to copy rootwrap files into, the copy would fail and the

- When executed on Mac OS X, python2 is not found.

- Documentation is added to describe how to use the script
  to handle periodic SHA bumps.

Change-Id: I628cd2c3156d118c17ca2f90d4ccf0bc5a080bbf
"}]
commit_message:
Fix sources-branch-updater and add docs

Problems resolved:

- Errors relating to 'etc' folders which did not exist in the
  target repositories have been eliminated.

- Some repositories were not being excluded from evaluation
  for file/template updates. All appropriate exclusions are
  now implemented.

- If an OSA role repository did not have the required folder
  to copy rootwrap files into, the copy would fail and the
  rootwrap files therefore be left out of the patch.

- When executed on Mac OS X, python2 is not found.

- Documentation is added to describe how to use the script
  to handle periodic SHA bumps.

Change-Id: I628cd2c3156d118c17ca2f90d4ccf0bc5a080bbf

subject: remove _append_null_domain_id decorator
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-17 02:13:05.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/core.py'], 'message': "remove _append_null_domain_id decorator

This decorator is only useful when upgrade Keystone form Liberty
to higher release. I don't think any deployments will upgrade
from Liberty to Queens directly. And Liberty is eol already. So
it's safe engouth to remove it.

Change-Id: I891b0d3e87e8c011a2db758fc84dbd4590f78c96
"}]
commit_message:
remove _append_null_domain_id decorator

This decorator is only useful when upgrade Keystone form Liberty
to higher release. I don't think any deployments will upgrade
from Liberty to Queens directly. And Liberty is eol already. So
it's safe engouth to remove it.

Change-Id: I891b0d3e87e8c011a2db758fc84dbd4590f78c96

subject: Fix APIException if cinder is not installed
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-01-18 14:10:59.000000000', 'files': ['sahara_tempest_plugin/tests/clients/test_node_group_templates.py'], 'message': 'Fix APIException if cinder is not installed

If cinder is not installed, Sahara API validation will return
an APIException with error message "Cinder is not supported".
Test case "test_node_group_templates" throw an exception:
  "saharaclient.api.base.APIException: Cinder is not supported"

Change-Id: Ic54eea43b9de9373320550d2e54cdaa415e1a603
'}]
commit_message:
Fix APIException if cinder is not installed

If cinder is not installed, Sahara API validation will return
an APIException with error message "Cinder is not supported".
Test case "test_node_group_templates" throw an exception:
  "saharaclient.api.base.APIException: Cinder is not supported"

Change-Id: Ic54eea43b9de9373320550d2e54cdaa415e1a603
